title: Material Handler/Inventory Associate
description:
PDC International Corp., located in Norwalk, CT engineers, manufactures packaging machinery for applying Heat Shrinkable Tamper-Evident Seals and Sleeve Labels worldwide to customers such as Kraft Foods, Unilever, Johnson & Johnson and Nestles to name a few.

**Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities**

* Receive manufactured components from machine shop, and log in part numbers into a desktop computer (data entry)
* Examine parts for defects or deviations from engineering specification drawing
* Coordinate parts deliveries and pick-up with outside vendors
* Engrave (label) parts for product identification
* Distribute parts internally to appropriate departments
* Assist with inventory control and audits as needed

**Skills and Abilities**

* Proficient in using inventory management systems and software (Macola)
* Experienced in database management and data entry; with strong knowledge of Excel and Microsoft Outlook
* Possess strong organizational skills to maintain an orderly and accessible inventory
* Able to read blueprints
* Ability to measure parts and utilize inspection tools such as gauges, calipers and micrometers
* Ability to lift and/or move over 40 lbs. of material
* Demonstrate strong verbal and written communication skills for interacting with colleagues and external vendors
* Positive Attitude

**Working Conditions and Physical Demands**

This is a manufacturing environment, and an individual must be able to lift material and components.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $20.00 - $25.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Paid training
* Referral program
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* Overtime
* Weekends as needed

Experience:

* Calipers: 1 year (Required)
* Microsoft Excel: 1 year (Required)
* Micrometer: 1 year (Required)
* Data entry: 1 year (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Norwalk, CT 06854: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Instrumentation and Electrical Technician
description:
LANXESS is a young company with strong roots! We derive our strength from global presence, management excellence and most importantly our people! Our employees are the pillars of our success.

We offer exciting career opportunities regionally as well as internationally, educational assistance programs, competitive pay and benefits, language training programs, and many other personal and professional development programs that are a part of our vision and values that drive our ongoing success.

**Job Highlights**

* Coordinate closely with operations teams to insure proper operation of equipment to achieve or exceed targeted operational effectiveness objectives.
* Responsible to ensure optimum performance, reliability, and uptime.
* Conduct preventative and corrective maintenance of electrical equipment and troubleshooting circuit problems while applying theory and related knowledge to install, rebuild, or repair electrical equipment as needed.
* Ensure all required tools, parts, and supplies are available for each job performed; will complete required services records; and will be responsible for recommending and/or initiating equipment modifications and/or replacement of electrical components as well as performing and supporting installation of new equipment.
* Actively learn the equipment, processes, and systems; participate in organizational improvement teams, safety committees, and quality improvement teams; and train/mentor other team members, including both maintenance and operations to foster their development in safety training control systems and troubleshooting capabilities

**Requirements**

* High School Diploma or equivalent, plus 2 yr technical degree or 5 years of industrial work experience in relevant electrical field.
* Minimum of 7 years manufacturing experience as IE technician.
* Clear and comprehensive written and verbal communication skills, basic mathematic and numeracy skills is required.
* PLC, DCS, and VFD experience strongly preferred.
* Available for on-call duty.

**What we offer you:**

* **Compensation:** We offer competitive compensation packages, inclusive of a global bonus program and an individual performance bonus program.
* **Comprehensive Benefits:** We provide a variety of benefits to support your financial security, health and wellbeing including retirement plans, health programs, life insurance and medical care.
* **Work-Life & Flexibility:** We support you in maintaining a balance between working hours and personal life. With our global “Xwork” program, we offer flexible working arrangements in all countries in which we operate.
* **Training & Development:** We are committed to your professional and personal development and encourage you in the ongoing pursuit of education, training and knowledge through both formal and informal learning.

**Diversity:** LANXESS is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, sex, sexual orientation, age, social class, physical ability or attributes, religion, national origin, veteran status and political beliefs.

LANXESS has a value-based performance culture. We are seeking a range of human interests, backgrounds, and experiences that can be engaged to achieve respect, ownership, trust, professionalism, integrity and healing across all sectors.

Join the LANXESS team!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $44.07 - $47.32 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance

title: Registered Behavior Technician-Willing to train!
description:
**Behavior Technician (BT/RBT)**

Momentum Behavior Care

Location: Tappan, NY

**Job details**

**About Us**

Momentum Behavior Care is an Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) therapy company focused on providing in-home and center based services for clients.

Our goal is for our employees to love what they do and to encourage an atmosphere of positive growth and learning. We place a high priority on employee well-being and work-life balance. We are successful because of our teamwork, and our employees share the mission of improving the lives of the children we serve.

Our Behavior Technicians are offered a variety of work environments, flexible schedules, and the support of our friendly management at all times.

**Job Responsibilities:**

As a Behavior Technician, you will:

* Work closely with a Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) to implement individualized behavior reduction and skill acquisition treatment plans.
* Provide 1-on-1 in-home and community-based ABA therapy in accordance with the schedule arranged with the client’s family
* In this role, you will come down to the client’s home or school for therapy sessions and ensure that the client is always in a safe, positive environment and is working on his/her goals effectively.
* Ensure client satisfaction by providing the highest quality of care and support possible.
* Log daily observations of the client, collecting and reporting critical data to help in monitoring each client’s progress.
* Receive recurring supervision by BCBA to ensure proper ABA techniques are practiced.
* We encourage you to apply if you will take pleasure in seeing your hard work help a child make progress and reach his maximum potential in a growth oriented environment while gaining new skills .

**What We Are Looking For:**

You have:

* The ability to communicate effectively in English.
* The ability to work flexible, part-time schedules with the possibility to gain full-time hours.
* A demonstrated ability to work with confidential information.
* Strong communication and problem solving skills (this role requires you to build rapport with the clients and families you work with).
* The ability to stay organized while multitasking in a fast-paced environment.
* The ability to stay consistent with you sessions.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $17.00 - $27.00 per hour

Expected hours: 15 – 20 per week

Benefits:

* Professional development assistance

Schedule:

* After school
* Day shift

Application Question(s):

* Can you work on weekends?
* Many kids have behavior challenges. Some kids may hit or pinch. Have you ever worked with children with problem behaviors before? If not, are you comfortable dong so?
* Have you ever been a caretaker for someone who needed help with toileting, dressing or general hygiene? If not, are you comfortable learning?
* How many years experience do you have working with children?
* Have you ever worked as a BT (Behavior Technician) under a BCBA (Board Certified Behavior Analyst) in ABA (Applied Behavior Analysis)
* Can you work afterschool hours (between 3-7pm)? **Required**
* Will you be able to drive to Tappan, NY?

Education:

* High school or equivalent (Required)

Experience:

* Childcare: 1 year (Required)

Language:

* English (Required)

Shift availability:

title: Production Assistant, FOX & Friends
description:
OVERVIEW OF THE COMPANY
Fox News Media
FOX News Media operates the FOX News Channel (FNC), FOX Business Network (FBN), FOX News Digital, FOX News Audio, FOX News Books, the direct-to-consumer digital streaming services FOX Nation and FOX News International and the newly announced platform FOX Weather. Currently the number one network in all of cable, FNC has also been the most watched television news channel for 20 consecutive years, while FBN currently ranks among the top business channels on cable. Owned by FOX Corporation, FOX News Media reaches 200 million people each month.
JOB DESCRIPTION
We are looking for a motivated Production Assistant to join the # 1 National Cable Morning Show, Fox & Friends. You will learn more here in 4 months on the job than you did in 4 years of college. The sky is the limit for someone eager to learn and grow in this fast-paced and competitive industry. As a Production Assistant, you will work to coordinate live guests, create content, and work closely with show producers. You are someone who is creative and has a competitive spirit.
A SNAPSHOT OF YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES* Interact with high-profile talent and all-level guests
* Coordinate remote live shots
* Create research packets for show segments
* Serve as quality control for video elements
* Produce guest segments and reporter hits while coordinating with studio and field crews
* Produce content for social media platforms
* Pitch story ideas and be willing to see them through from start to finish


WHAT YOU WILL NEED* A Bachelor's degree in journalism or a related field of study preferred, or equivalent experience
* 1-2 years of TV news or communications experience
* Great communication skills, go-getter attitude, and ability to be a team player
* Strong digital and social media skills
* Willingness to pitch in on additional projects as needed


#EntryLevel #EarlyCareer #LI-DNI*We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We are deeply committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion, including attracting, retaining, and promoting diverse talent across our company. We live in a diverse world, with different ideas and different perspectives that come together to spark new ideas and make great things happen. That means reflecting the diversity of the world around us is critical to our company’s success. We ensure that our viewers, communities and employees feel heard, represented, and celebrated both on screen and off.*

title: Line Producer, FOX & Friends
description:
OVERVIEW OF THE COMPANY
Fox News Media
FOX News Media operates the FOX News Channel (FNC), FOX Business Network (FBN), FOX News Digital, FOX News Audio, FOX News Books, the direct-to-consumer digital streaming services FOX Nation and FOX News International and the newly announced platform FOX Weather. Currently the number one network in all of cable, FNC has also been the most watched television news channel for 20 consecutive years, while FBN currently ranks among the top business channels on cable. Owned by FOX Corporation, FOX News Media reaches 200 million people each month.
JOB DESCRIPTION
We are looking for a talented Line Producer to join the Fox & Friends team. As a Line Producer on Fox & Friends, your main daily responsibility will be translating the editorial vision for the show into an organized rundown and overseeing its live production on air. This includes building the rundown, making timing decisions, copy-editing segments, producing opens and teases, and communicating directly with anchors and executives.
The Line Producer for Fox & Friends must be detail-oriented and a natural self-starter who is not afraid to make decisions and lead a team. You should also have outstanding judgment, organizational skills, and creativity in teases and scripts. Most of all, you must be an effective communicator who can serve as the main point of contact for producers, directors, and talent/crew in the field. As the Line Producer, you can have your entire show planned, but at the very last minute, you can throw out your rundown and remain calm for breaking news. The Line Producer should be flexible and able to adjust on the fly in breaking news situations.  

A SNAPSHOT OF YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES* Participate in editorial meetings, pitch stories, and segment ideas, & build and maintain the corresponding rundown throughout the week
* Manage team assignments and provide editorial guidance
* Handle all aspects of pre-production (segments, package approval, reporter scripts)
* Write/copy edit scripts as needed, as well as banners
* Fact-check research packets for anchors
* Guide the technical crew through each element during the show
* Keep the anchor on time using clear and effective cues
* Monitor the aesthetics of the screen to make sure visuals support the conversation
* Effectively manage your own time and attention; prioritize and delegate tasks when necessary

  

WHAT YOU WILL NEED* 5+ years of prior television (or similar) experience
* Experience in a live control room
* A Bachelor’s degree in journalism or a related field of study preferred, or equivalent experience
* Experience interacting with talent
* Exceptional editorial skills: ability to recognize stories and elements with high potential for compelling television
* Effective communication skills: ability to provide clarity and reassurance in high-pressure situations
* Passion for organization; ability to simplify complicated tasks under pressure
* Solid base understanding of technical skills (specifically newsroom and video editing software)
* Strong interest/knowledge of news, current events, politics, and pop culture
* Willingness to listen, learn, and grow from constructive criticism


 #LI-DNI*We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with applicable law.**At FOX, we foster a culture and environment where everyone feels welcome and can thrive. We are deeply committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion, including attracting, retaining, and promoting diverse talent across our company. We live in a diverse world, with different ideas and different perspectives that come together to spark new ideas and make great things happen. That means reflecting the diversity of the world around us is critical to our company’s success. We ensure that our viewers, communities and employees feel heard, represented, and celebrated both on screen and off.*

title: Paralegal- EDCAP Unit
description:
OVERVIEW: For more than 50 years, Legal Services of Long Island previously (Nassau Suffolk Law Services), has been providing free, high-quality legal counsel in civil matters when basic human needs are at stake including: eviction and foreclosure prevention, income maintenance, disability, elder law, healthcare, consumer fraud and more. As the only provider of comprehensive civil legal services on Long Island, our services support thousands of poor and low-income families and individuals who cannot afford an attorney. With the gap separating those who can and cannot afford legal representation widening each day, we work to ensure that everyone has equal access to justice, regardless of their ability to pay. Legal Services of Long Island has a staff of over one hundred people situated in three offices across Long Island.

OFFICE LOCATION: Nassau County and Suffolk County Offices.

DUTIES: LSLI has partnered with the Community Service Society (CSS) to provide legal services with an initiative called the Education Debt Consumer Assistance Program (EDCAP). EDCAP is focused on helping consumers navigate their student loan debt.

JOB DESCRIPTION: Duties entail community education regarding student loan repayment, counseling borrowers, and assisting the Supervising Attorney with student debt litigation matters. This will include providing over the phone, remote video conferencing and in-person assistance to individuals who need help with higher education debt, including selecting an appropriate repayment plan, loan consolidation, applying for forgiveness and discharge programs, avoiding, or getting out of default, and much more; Provide trainings and presentations to consumers and advocates, as needed; Prepare training materials and fact sheets. Paralegal is responsible for maintaining required case files, client data and all statistical information as required.

START DATE: Immediate

SALARY: $43,558-$53,058, DOE, union scale, BENEFITS: Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Long Term Disability (100% of the premium covered by employer), 403b with defined contribution.

REQUIREMENTS: Paralegal training or college degree or appropriate prior experience; Excellent oral communication and writing skills; Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Outlook; Strong attention to detail and organizational ability to prioritize and multi-task; Demonstrated commitment to the goals and clients of the legal services program; Bilingual proficiency in English and Spanish preferred.

title: Behavior Technician
description:
**\\*SEEKING: Full-time ABA Therapist/Behavior Technician (ABAs/LBAs/RBTs welcome!)\\***

*Perfect for BCBA/LBA Supervision for Those Working Towards Their Certification!*

Seeking an enthusiastic, energetic and passionate person for a full-time position on the Upper East Side, Manhattan. The role involves working with a sweet, loving 6-year-old boy with well-controlled epilepsy full-time, Monday-Friday from 8:00am - 4:00pm, most at school/camp and at home as well.

**Responsibilities**:

- Accompanying the child at his mainstream Jewish day school/camp.

- Supervise and assist with ADLs and personal care.

- Enforcing special diet and restrictions.

- Encouraging social-emotional learning, emotional and behavior regulation.

- Implement behavior intervention plans designed by Board Certified Behavior Analysts (BCBAs)

- Provide one-on-one Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) therapy to clients

- Collect and record data on client behavior during sessions

- Assist in the development of treatment goals and objectives

- Collaborate with the clinical team to ensure effective communication and progress tracking

- Maintain client confidentiality and adhere to HIPAA guidelines

- Support clients in various settings to generalize skills learned during therapy sessions

**Experience:**

- Registered/Behavior Technician experience

- Prior experience working with individuals with autism or related developmental disabilities preferred

- Familiarity with behavioral health interventions and strategies

- Knowledge of data collection methods and techniques

- Experience in patient care, especially children, is beneficial

- Understanding of medical terminology and documentation practices

- Ability to follow behavioral therapy protocols accurately

- Proficiency in maintaining accurate data daily during sessions

**Benefits**:

- Competitive salary on the books, with the legal employee protections and benefits, including Social Security.

- This position offers 25-30 hours/week BCBA/LBA supervision for those working towards their certification.

**Educational/Professional** **Requirements**:

- Bachelor's or Master's degree, preferably in education, ABA, psychology or similar.

- Previous experience with special needs children is a **must**. Preference for candidates who have worked as paras or studying Applied Behavioral Analysis.

**Characteristics**:

- Very responsible and trustworthy.

- Good intuition and instincts.

- Capable of establishing deep and loving connections with kids.

- Able to engage in age-appropriate education, activities and fun.

**Details**:

- Location: Upper East Side, NYC

- Start Date: Summer (flexible)

- Hours: Monday-Friday, 8:00 AM - 4:00 PM (optional to end earlier on Fridays)

- Commitment: Applicants must commit to the full 2024-2025 school year

**\\*Serious applicants only.\\*** 

If you are passionate about making a difference in a child's life and meet the qualifications, we would love to hear from you!

Please send your resume and cover letter to agonen5786@gmail.com or call/text 646-732-3613.

This position offers an opportunity to make a meaningful impact on the lives of individuals with autism spectrum disorders. If you are passionate about helping others reach their full potential through evidence-based interventions, we encourage you to apply.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $25.00 - $30.00 per hour

title: Territory Sales Manager, Southern CA, AZ
description:
**Territory Sales Manager, Southern CA, AZ** **-** **(****30007711****)****Description** **Why Ansell?**

At Ansell, by staying two steps ahead of workplace risk we aim to deliver innovative safety solutions that enhance people's quality of life. As a global leader in protection solutions, we design and develop a wide range of products including gloves, clothing, and other protective gear, to keep workers safe and productive in industrial, medical, and consumer applications.  


Discover more about our company, our team, and our values by visiting us at Ansell.  


**Ansell is looking for a Territory Sales Manager to join our team in Southern, CA or AZ!**  



In this position you will play a vital role in prospecting, selling; training, in-servicing; distribution sales and management and administrative work (PAM, QlikView, CRM, etc.)
**The salary range for this role is from $70,000 to $130,000**. Specific pricing for this role may vary within this range based on many factors including geographic location, candidate experience, and skills. Candidate may also be eligible for additional compensation and/or benefits.
**What benefits and opportunities does Ansell offer?**
* Competitive compensation plan, including a performance based annual incentive.
* Fully remote work model.
* An inclusive and collaborative environment that values diversity and fosters an international culture.
* Ansell University programs to develop professional and interpersonal skills.
* Opportunities to advance and grow within the company.
* Health Benefits: medical, dental, vision, short term and long- term disability and wellness programs

* Paid time off (vacation, sick and personal days) 14 paid holidays

**What your role will be?**
* Selling and representation of Ansell products and services to the Acute Market, (i.e., acute care and surgery center settings) in the Southern CA, AZ territory.
* Prospect accounts develop support for Ansell products, and close new business!
* Develop and nurture Integrated Delivery Network (IDN) and Regional Purchasing Coalition (RPC) level accounts.
* Cold calling, appointment setting, product demonstrations, in-services, product evaluations, pipeline management, negotiating and consistently closing!

* Regular travel throughout the Southern CA, AZ territory with the purpose of initiating, developing, and closing sales opportunities.
* Service current client base at both the end user and distributor levels.
* Garner broad support at the highest levels in prospects to ensure executive sponsorship and support for the Ansell value proposition.
* Build and maintain a healthy sales pipeline to achieve sales objectives.
* Partner with Sales, Marketing, Sales Operations, Sales Support and Customer Service Departments.

**Roles and Responsibilities:** This job description is not an exclusive or exhaustive list of all job functions that an employee in this position may be asked to perform from time to time.

* Wash dishes and operate the dishwasher to clean all chinaware, silverware and cooking utensils.
* Scrub pots and pans.
* Burnish, de-tarnish and polish silver.
* Stock and maintain supplies and equipment.
* Perform cleaning duties including, but not limited to, mopping and removing trash.
* Transport and store clean service ware.
* Train other stewards, as needed.
* Prepare and place clean service ware for events and functions.

* Must be able to speak, read, write and understand the English which the primary language is used in this workplace.

**Requirements:** Due to the cyclical nature of the hospitality industry, employees may be required to work varying schedules **(including Holidays and weekends)** to reflect the business needs of the hotel. In addition, attendance at all scheduled training sessions and meetings is required.

* Strong ability to multitask and work in a fast paced environment.
* **Physical:** Requires bending, stooping, climbing, standing, walking, sitting, reaching, grasping, carrying, repetitive motions, visual acuity, hearing, writing and good verbal skills.

title: IEP Coordinator - Bronx Day School
description:
**"Urgently Hiring!! Looking to fill as soon as possible!!”**


**The salary range for this position is $60k-$75k annually**


**The hours at the school are from 8:00 am - 3:30 pm Monday-Friday**


**Job Summary**  

QSAC is hiring! We are looking for a detail oriented and enthusiastic IEP Coordinator to assist in the development and implementation of IEPs across multiple age and ability ranges. Will also assist in the design and maintenance of a structured learning environment as well as support educational staff in the implementation of applied behavior analysis to the school setting.



We provide extensive support, training and opportunities for growth both professionally and within the agency.


**Job responsibilities include, but are not limited to:**


* Receive and review all Individualized Education Plan /Central Base Support Team (IEP/CBST) packets/referrals for placement across all center based educational programs for accuracy/completion/appropriateness upon receipt from Committee Preschool Education (CPSE/CSE)
* Participate in student intake process and ensure regular communication with district administrators/referral sources
* Ensure each teacher implements and manages IEP review and IEPs receipts
* Provide IEP related training to teachers and assistants/aides
* Develop professional clinical competency through attendance/participation in staff meetings, workshops and conferences
* Participate in IEP meetings, as needed
* Provide ongoing communication with families as related to IEP development/referral for placement
* Provide regular communication with classroom and administrative staff regarding submission of reports/components of IEP mandates and requirements
* Attend/participate/develop classroom and or school-wide training
* Review Student Quarterly reports
* Ensure receipt of progress reports from classroom teachers and related service providers.
* Oversee dissemination of progress reports to home/district


**Qualifications and Work Experience**


* Master’s in Special Education or related field
* SAS/SBL/SDA or equivalent preferred
* Possess and maintain Board Certified Behavior Analyst Credentials (BCBA) analyst in good standing highly preferred
* 2-3 years training experience in Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA)


**Mission**



QSAC is a New York City and Long Island based nonprofit that supports children and adults with autism, together with their families, in achieving greater independence, realizing their future potential, and contributing to their communities in a meaningful way by offering person-centered services. QSAC pursues this mission through direct services that provide a supportive and individualized setting for children and adults with autism to improve their communication, socialization, academic, and functional skills.

  


**Benefits**



QSAC benefits are terrific and go beyond health and retirement! You will be joining a passionate community of professionals and staff who support each other in a challenging and rewarding work culture.


* Competitive salary
* Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance have very low out of pocket costs (for FT staff)
* Medical can be as low as $1 dollar per paycheck / $26 dollars a year for full medical coverage ( for FT staff)
* Generous Paid Time Off policy (for full time staff)
* Group Life Insurance and Long Term Disability (for FT staff)
* Flexible Spending Accounts (for FT staff)
* Pre-Tax Commuter Benefits
* 403(b) Retirement with Employer Discretionary Match (for FT staff)
* Opportunities for career advancement
* Qualifications are subject to change in accordance with government regulations.


* **We adhere to all strict COVID guidelines at all of our programs and sites.**



Qualifications are subject to change in accordance with government regulations.



QSAC is Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE)


**Mission-Oriented. Results-Driven. Collaborative. Passionate. We Are QSAC.**


**To easily apply: please send resume to jobs@qsac.com**

title: QS Technical Writer
description:
Driven by a commitment to research, quality and service, PDI provides innovative products, educational resources, training and support to prevent infection transmission and promote health and wellness. Encompassing three areas, our Healthcare, Sani Professional and Contract manufacturing divisions, we develop, manufacture and distribute leading edge products for North America and the world. We have several locations across the US and are looking for new Associates to join our team!


**POSITION PURPOSE**



The Quality Systems Technical Writer is responsible for supporting the Quality Systems team as well as the broad organization by producing clear and concise documentation as well as creating innovative ideas for content while working both independently and collaboratively as part of the team. The Quality Systems Technical writer plays a crucial role in ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements and facilitating effective communication within our organization and with external stakeholders. Additionally, the role ensures that all documentations adheres to established guidelines and best practices and supports the conversion of complex information into user-friendly documents.


**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND BASIC DUTIES**


* Reviews local Quality Management System (QMS) documents to ensure clear & reader friendly language.
* Develop/Edit Standard Operating Procedures and Work Instructions related to processes used in a Pharmaceutical GMP environment, adhering to standards, templates, and best practices.
* Collaborates cross-functionally with other departments &maintains stakeholder relationships  

Provides specialist knowledge on the writing process to ease understanding, choice of document type, structure, style & language usage of the operational documents.
* Coaches document owners in the knowledge of good communication & standards in operational documents.
* Review and/or copyedit content developed by other members of the team Determine the clearest and most logical way to present information for greatest reader comprehension.
* Supports document owners in the writing process with language usage, document revision process, standardization, change control process & related tools
* Generate innovative ideas for content and workflow solutions
* Attend and/or Facilitate Subject Matter Expert meetings to define/refine document content and gain alignment between stakeholders.
* Participate in Process Team meetings to support project planning related to Technical Writing support
* Complete special projects/tasks as assigned


**PERFORMANCE MEASUREMENTS**


* On time completion of clear and concise new documents or revisions to existing documentation
* On time completion of special projects/tasks assigned


**EDUCATION/CERTIFICATION**


* Associate's degree in life science, pharmaceutical sciences, chemistry, or a related field or equivalent combination of education & experience required. Bachelor's degree preferred


**REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE**


* Advanced technical writing skills and the ability to communicate effectively with peers, department management, and cross-functional coworkers
* Familiarity with compliance requirements within cGMP with an emphasis on procedures, process validations, and reporting requirements preferred
* Ability to read, write & understand complicated product documentation & standard operating procedures with attention to high-level concepts
* Knowledgeable in core work processes & GMP concepts, knowledge of process improvement methodologies such as LEAN a plus
* Understanding of analytical techniques and methodologies
* Understanding and experience with problem solving techniques (root cause analysis) is preferred


**REQUIRED EXPERIENCE**


* Five (5) years of experience in technical writing, preferably in a pharmaceutical or other life sciences environment.
* Advanced word processing using Microsoft Word and other Microsoft Office products.
* Experience working in an Electronic Document Management System (EDMS)


**SKILLS/ABILITIES**


* Superior written and verbal communications skills
* Strong fluency in the English language and grammatical application thereof
* Advanced MS Word skills, including using styles and formatting tables, demonstrated competency with MS Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook
* Able to multi-task and quickly adjust to changing priorities without sacrificing quality or timely task completion
* Highly organized, accountable, and able to work in an independent and self-directed work environment


**WORKING CONDITIONS**


* No hazardous or significantly unpleasant conditions


**SALARY RANGE**


* $70,000 - $80,000 annually


**BENEFITS**


**PDI is pleased to offer comprehensive and affordable benefits for our associates, which includes:**


* Medical, behavioral & prescription drug coverage
* Health Savings Account (HSA)
* Dental
* Vision
* 401(k) savings plan with company match and profit sharing
* Basic and supplemental Life and AD&D insurance
* Flexible Spending Accounts (FSAs)
* Short & long-term disability
* Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
* Health Advocacy Program


**PDI also offers many voluntary benefits such as:** Legal services, critical illness, hospital indemnity, accident coverage, ID theft and fraud protection, pet insurance and employee discounts.


**At PDI, we are also committed to helping our associates maintain a healthy and sustainable work/life balance and are proud to provide associates with paid time off programs including:** sick & safe leave, vacation, company & floating holidays, paid parental leave, and depending on the position we also offer summer hours and flex place/flex time options.



#LI-PDI



#LI-ONSITE


Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities


The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

title: Junior Apprentice Technician
company: The Southeast Morris County Municipal Utilities Authority
description:
**Title:** Junior Apprentice Technician (Water Transmission and Distribution)

**Location:** Cedar Knolls, NJ (On-site)

**Status**: Full Time (40 hours), Non-exempt (Entry-Level)

**Salary:** $50,291.64 Annually + Overtime

***PLEASE SEE THE FULL JOB DESCRIPTION AND APPLICATION SUBMISSION DETAILS AT OUR WEBSITE: smcmua.org/careers.htm***

**Benefits:**

We offer a competitive salary package, commensurate with experience, Comprehensive Health Benefits (medical, dental, vision), PTO including vacation, sick, and other forms of PTO, Pension + Supplementary Retirement benefits, 457b option, Tuition Reimbursement/paid training, FSA, Life insurance (waiting periods may apply).

**Job Description Scope**:

Our candidate of choice will be responsible for performing various manual and maintenance assignments in the Operations Division including assignments in the Distribution, Treatment, Fleet Maintenance, and Facility Maintenance sub-divisions. This is an entry-level position with successive opportunities for promotion.

**Key Responsibilities**:

1. Renders services to provide potable water.

2. Demonstrated a high level of customer service by Authority standards.

3. Operate related vehicles and equipment such as snowplows, cranes, vacuum systems, valve operating equipment and tow equipment, trailers, etc.

4. Use various hand tools.

5. Use various power tools and equipment.

6. Load, unload, and lift supplies, equipment, etc.

7. Clean and sweep streets and sidewalks.

8. Sort, pile, and clean salvageable brick, stone, lumber, and metal work.

9. Dig trenches and manually grade grounds.

10. Collect rubbish and other refuse.

11. Tree trimming and removal.

12. Cut grass; rake lawns; trim hedges, lawns, brush, and trees.

13. Remove poisonous and non-poisonous underbrush, foliage, vines, and weeds.

14. Shovel snow, dirt, gravel, sand, and other miscellaneous debris.

15. Operate snow removal and salting equipment to keep roads, parking lots, driveways, etc. clear and safe.

16. Assist with the maintenance, inspection, and repair of treatment and pumping/storage equipment, tanks, pumps, processes, industrial controls, and other related treatment and pumping/storage equipment and facilities.

17. Assist with the operation, maintenance, inspection, and repair of distribution mains, service lines, fire hydrants, valves, valve boxes, curb boxes, pavement, meters, and other related distribution equipment and facilities.

18. Assist with the maintenance, inspection, and repair of Authority buildings and grounds; such as changing of light bulbs, cleaning, painting, grass cutting, hedge trimming, snow/ice removal, and related assignments.

19. Basic maintenance, inspection, and repair of Authority vehicles and equipment; such as changing light bulbs, windshield wipers, fluid, and lubrication addition, changing of tires, changing batteries, and related assignments. Performs related and other duties, as assigned.

20. Performs related and other duties, as assigned.

**Qualifications:**

***EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE***

* U.S accredited high school diploma or equivalent.
* NJ Basic driver’s license (required)
* NJ Commercial Driver’s License, Class B with air brake endorsement (preferred, permit required within 6-month probationary period)

***SKILLS & COMPETENCIES***

* Ability to read, write and understand English so that involved and complicated instructions and technical texts can be read and understood, and legible written records can be produced and maintained.
* Ability to understand, remember and carry out oral and written directions; to learn quickly from oral and written explanations and demonstrations; to deal knowledgeably and courteously with co-workers, customers, and the general public.
* Entry-level experience in the operation, maintenance, and/or repair of motors, pumps, hydrants, valves, or other similar equipment in water, wastewater, or industrial applications and/or related experience such as that obtained by serving in the United States military.
* Ability to utilize information technology to perform the functions of this position.
* Working harmoniously with co-workers, supervisors, managers, and the public.
* Maintain an understanding and satisfactory compliance with the SMCMUA policies, procedures, practices, processes, and essential functions required for the position.

**Company Description:**

In 1977, the Governing Bodies of Morristown, Morris Township, Morris Plains, and Hanover Township (the Creating Municipalities) passed parallel ordinances creating The Southeast Morris County Municipal Utilities Authority (SMCMUA). SMCMUA provides high-quality drinking water to customers in Morristown, Morris Township, Morris Plains, and Hanover Township with some service in Mendham Township and Harding Township, and to certain customers and municipalities outside its District in Morris County, New Jersey. On a typical day, about 100,000 people rely on SMCMUA's commitment to high quality for their drinking water needs.

**Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action:**

SMCMUA prohibits discrimination based on the following protected categories: race, creed, color, national origin, nationality, ancestry, age, sex/gender, pregnancy, marital status, civil status, domestic partnership status, familial status, religion, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, atypical hereditary cellular or blood trait, genetic information, liability for service in the Armed Forces of the United States, and disability.

* Employee assistance program
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Professional development assistance
* Retirement plan
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

title: Production Supervisor
description:
**Job Title:** Production Supervisor

**Company:** Concreteworks East Location: East Brunswick, NJ

**About Us:** Concreteworks East is a leading manufacturer of architectural precast concrete, collaborating with top architects and contractors nationwide. We pride ourselves on our commitment to quality, innovation, and excellence in every project we undertake.

**Position Overview**: We are seeking a dedicated and experienced Production Supervisor to lead our team of 25 skilled workers. The ideal candidate will be responsible for ensuring a safe, disciplined, and respectful work environment that adheres to company standards and policies. Strong leadership and accountability are essential traits for this role.

**Key Responsibilities:** 

· Safety Leadership: Promote and maintain a safe work environment by enforcing safety protocols and conducting regular safety meetings.

· Discipline and Compliance: Ensure that all work processes conform to company standards and policies, maintaining a disciplined and efficient work environment.

· Respectful Workplace: Foster a culture of respect and collaboration among team members.

· Lean Manufacturing: Utilize lean manufacturing principles such as 5Y, Managing Daily Improvement, and 5S to enhance productivity and efficiency.

· Team Leadership: Provide clear direction, support, and mentorship to the shop team, ensuring high performance and accountability.

· Performance Metrics: Lead performance metrics to ensure workers stay on schedule and on budget.

· Problem Solving: Address and resolve any issues or conflicts that arise in the shop promptly and effectively.

· Communication: Maintain open and effective communication with all team members and management.

**Role Management:** This role reports directly to the Production Manager. Your direct subordinates would be Production Team Leaders.

**Qualifications:** 

· Proven experience as a Production Supervisor or in a similar leadership or supervisory role.

· Strong knowledge of safety protocols and regulations.

· Familiarity with lean manufacturing principles (5Y, Managing Daily Improvement, 5S) is a plus.

· Excellent leadership and team management skills.

· Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail.

· Bilingual abilities are a plus.

· Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

**Benefits:** 

· Competitive salary

· Health, dental, and vision insurance

· Paid time off

· Retirement plan

· Opportunities for professional development

**How to Apply:** Interested candidates are invited to submit their resume and a cover letter detailing their relevant experience and qualifications to careers@concreteworkseast.com. Join Concreteworks East and be a part of a team that values quality, innovation, and excellence. We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Associate Scientist I
description:
Job Description
At Azenta, new ideas, new technologies and new ways of thinking are driving our future. Our customer-focused culture encourages employees to embrace innovation and challenge the status quo with novel thinking and collaborative work relationships.


Azenta Life Sciences is a global leader in the life sciences space with headquarters in Burlington, MA, and offices and operations worldwide. We are a market leader in automated bio sample management solutions and genomic services across areas such as drug development, clinical and advanced cell therapies for the industry's top pharmaceutical, biotech, academic and healthcare institutions globally. We provide unparalleled capabilities with our lab analysis, sample management and storage services, informatics software, and consumables, with the largest installed base managing over 1 billion samples globally.

**How You’ll Make an Impact**  

  

Be an integral part of an exciting, fast-growing team where you can leverage your outstanding bench skills in our regulated NGS laboratory! With your molecular background, you will be able to utilize not only your existing skills, but will also learn many new techniques, creating attractive new growth opportunities.

 **What You’ll Do**

* Prepare amplified template libraries for high-throughput sequencing
* Carry out DNA sequencing on next-generation DNA analyzers
* Perform routine maintenance of DNA analyzers and related equipment
* Check inventory and replenish consumable sequencing supplies
* Communicate with customers by phone and e-mail in a friendly and professional manner
* Sample quality and quantity check using various methods and equipment
* DNA and RNA extraction from cell pellets and tissues
* Proper operation and routine maintenance of MiSeq, monitor run performance

**What You Will Bring**

* BS in Biological Sciences or equivalent required.
* Some laboratory benchwork experience required
* Understanding of Molecular Biology principles and technologies
* Experience in a Next Generation Sequencing lab preferred.
* Ability to multitask and meet deadlines in a fast-paced customer oriented environment.
* Highly motivated and well organized.
* Independent, detailed oriented, team player.
* Closely follow Standard Operating Protocols (SOPs).
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, both verbal and written.
* Ability to react to situations with a sense of urgency.
* Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills
* Excellent documentation and record keeping skills

description:
**Juniper Seeks Part Time Bartender/Server**  
Juniper seeks an experienced Bartender/Server for hire. Weekend and evening availability is required. Pay is $16 per hour plus tips.

We value intelligence, verve and drive.

Juniper is a New American restaurant located in The Vanderbilt hotel and residences in Westbury, Long Island.

Juniper's menu highlights Long Island's bounty of produce, meat and fish, with a focus on steaks, American wine and a robust cocktail program.

Applicants should have at least 5+ years’ experience bartending in an upscale, high-volume, fast paced restaurant. We are looking for those that are comfortable multitasking and prioritizing their job duties. Learn more about us by visiting juniperlongisland.com.

ABOUT CIVETTA HOSPITALITY:  
Our restaurant group operates three full scale restaurants: Amali on the Upper East Side, Calissa in Southampton, and Juniper in Westbury, Long Island. We are fortunate to have received several accolades. Amali was an Eater 38 Essential NYC Restaurant for over seven years, was named one of America's Best 100 Wine Restaurants by Wine Enthusiast and has received Wine Spectator's "Best Of" Award of Excellence for the past three years. We are a High Road employer, a member of RAISE, and Slow Food Certified. Learn more about us by visiting juniperlongisland.com.

title: Treatment Coordinator
description:
We are a General Dentistry practice in Englewood, NJ seeking a Treatment Coordinator to join our team

The ideal Treatment Coordinator is a professional, organized, reliable, team player who has a vital role in our practice. You'll be responsible for scheduling appointments, ensuring patients feel welcome and safe at the office, presenting treatment, explaining financial options, calculating co-payments, and following up.

**Responsibilities would include:**

* Respond to incoming calls, emails, and text messages promptly.
* Educate patients about the details of their treatment plan and associated fees after the dentist has diagnosed and reviewed their options.
* Help patients understand their dental insurance benefits. Accurately calculate how much insurance will help with the cost of needed care. Communicate and collect the estimated patient co-payment amounts.
* Work with outside patient care financing companies to give our patients a wide range of financial options.
* Verify patient insurance eligibility prior to appointments
* Address and collect patient balances.
* Correctly schedule future appointments for patients checking-out to ensure doctors and hygienists are busy and productive
* Answer treatment questions patients have both before and after their visit
* Follow up via email or text with patients who haven’t scheduled their treatment
* Submit and follow up on pre-approvals
* Verify and submit insurance claims
* Generate and review reports
* Monitor treatment plans and case acceptance
* Address patient concerns and work with the team to improve service quality

**Qualifications:**

* Dentrix Ascend experience a must.
* 5+ years experience

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $30.00 - $33.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

The Housekeeping Attendant (or "Housekeeper") position must demonstrate and promote a strong commitment to providing the best possible experience for our guests and associates. The position is responsible for cleaning guest rooms in accordance with company guidelines and procedures.

* Ensures housekeeping carts, cart rooms and laundry areas are maintained to company standard while in use.
* Stocks carts and cart rooms if necessary and or directed by management.

* The associate must be able to perform thorough cleaning of facilities pursuant to company standards, policies and procedures. While performing the duties of this job, the associate is regularly required to remain stationary, be mobile, navigate the hotel, handle, reach, and detect objects, tools, or controls, and detect scent and detect sounds.

title: Store Manager (Staten Island Mall)
description:
***Are you passionate about bubble tea businesses?***

***Are you someone who always thrives to grow and accomplish more?***

***If yes, join us today!***

***If not now, when?***

***If not me, who?***

Founded in Toronto, Real Fruit Bubble Tea has been committed to making fresh fruit drinks healthy and accessible for anyone to enjoy since 2002. We have 128 locations across Canada and USA. As a rapidly expanding business, we want you to join our team and grow with us, and we can build you up from store manager to regional manager and beyond! **There is huge potential for growth, and we welcome anyone who is up to a challenging yet rewarding journey!**

**Position Description**

Reporting to the Regional Manager and above, the Muti-Unit Store Manager is responsible for supervising and overseeing the sales performance of the stores and ensuring the proper shift assignment for staffs that work at the store. They are also responsible for fostering an inclusive, passionate, energetic, and welcoming retail environment and help co-workers to constantly grow and improve.

**Duties and Responsibilities**

· Maintain frequent and uninterrupted communication with the Regional Manager and ensure that the company's regulatory and operational policies and guidelines of the store are followed.

· Propose and establish an achievable sales goal for the store, and to encourage, inspire and propel the co-workers to work collectively to accomplish it.

· Ensure that all co-workers comply with the company's operating standards, and store's policies regarding food safety and sanitation regulations are strictly followed and applied.

· Train, supervise and discipline all partners on procedures and provide ongoing feedback for improvement.

· Foster a welcoming and energetic environment that embodies that philosophy of Real Fruit Bubble Tea’s visions and belief.

· Demonstrate exceptional guest service and superior follow-up skills with customers or potential customers.

· Assist in store operations by preparing ingredients, maintaining inventory levels, ensuring cleanliness, and any ad hoc tasks.

· Ensure that all partners are operating safely and in compliance with the Ontario Occupational Health and Safety Act (OHSA) and Employment Standards Act (ESA).

**Ideal Candidate Competencies**

* **Attitude:** proven entrepreneur spirit of working "on-floor" spontaneously, as to motivate and propel the frontline personnel in person and to serve as the role model for co-workers
* **Results-Oriented:** demonstrates the ability to consistently perform optimal business results by meeting deadlines and achieving pre-determined goals
* **Communication:** effectively conveys necessary information and ideas in concise and meaningful exchanges through verbal and written communications
* **Teamwork/Collaboration**: effectively develops healthy relationships with co-workers and encourages idea-sharing that assists to accomplish goals
* **Initiative:** proactively seeking opportunities to work outside of job scope to assist various business departments and demonstrates the ability to always go beyond what is required to achieve goals
* **Personal Adaptability:** demonstrates the ability to welcome and embrace changes and effectively adjusts to newly altered environment within the business

**Expectation of Successful Candidate**

· 3+ years of store manager experiences, or 5+ years of working experiences within the food industry

· Language proficiency in English, with strong oral and written communication skills

· Strong leadership and interpersonal skills

· Strong multitasking skills and ability to perform tasks effectively under pressure

· Exceptional customer service skills and demonstrate strong communication

· High level of organizational capabilities

· Ability to implement RFBT's policies and procedures effectively

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $18.00 - $25.00 per hour

Schedule:

* Day shift
* Evening shift
* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Education:

* High school or equivalent (Preferred)

Experience:

* Food and Beverage Management: 1 year (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* Driver's License (Preferred)

Willingness to travel:

* 75% (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Maitre d'
description:
Help us deliver the **WOW-Factor** to our guests, as our **Maitre'D** of Virgil's Times Square!

At Virgil’s Real BBQ, our genuine southern home-style experience with authentic BBQ and American dishes keep guests walking in our doors. Our award winning BBQ is smoked on premise and our amazing team enjoys creating exceptional guest experiences with teamwork and incredible BBQ.

Virgil's Real BBQ, located in Times Square, is seeking an experienced Maitre'd who is authentically warm, energetic, and is passionate about teamwork. Our Maitre'D builds great connections with our regular guests, and our front of house team. This role takes reservations, works strategically with the management team on coordinating seating, assigns tables, and seats every guest in a strategic manner while informing guests about our dining options and who we are.The ideal candidates for this role will be friendly, have excellent communication skills, be exceptionally organized, thrive in a team based environment, and preferably experienced with Open Table..

* Community Wellbeing: Paid Community Service Hours
* Career Wellbeing: Leadership Development
* Learn more about our Total Wellbeing program

**What You’ll Be Doing:**

As a Maintenance Technician, your day-to-day will involve addressing resident service requests, performing diverse hands-on maintenance tasks, and ensuring market-ready apartments. Additionally, you will perform preventative maintenance and maintain the grounds and common areas, reporting any concerns.

* Promptly addressing resident service requests
* Performing hands-on maintenance tasks, including plumbing, electrical work, and more
* Preparing market-ready apartments and maintaining community grounds
* Conducting regular community inspections to identify necessary repairs or replacements
* Please note, this role will oversee multiple communities.

**What You’ll Need To Thrive:**

* Hands-on maintenance experience in areas including, but not limited to plumbing, electrical, appliance, and HVAC is necessary.
* High School diploma or equivalent
* Valid driver’s license and good driving record along with auto insurance will be required when working between multiple sites that require driving throughout the day. If you do not possess a valid driver’s license, you will be required to sign an addendum agreeing not to drive any form of registered motorized vehicle while at work/on the clock.
* Computer literacy, and must be able to effectively communicate both orally and in writing in English for all work-related purposes
* Knowledge of federal and state apartment housing laws
* Availability to work a flexible schedule, including weekends
* Must be able to respond to emergencies after normal business hours and on weekends when assigned on-call responsibilities; a telephone number where you can be reached after-hours must be provided to your manager
* Service team employees, with limited exceptions, are required to use their own smartphone to perform certain aspects of their job

**Bonus Qualifications:**

* Trade school certification/diploma
* EPA Section 608 Type I, Type II or Universal certification
* Residential or commercial property management, hospitality, or retail experience

title: Property Manager
description:
**Property Manager**

597 Westport, a luxury community in Norwalk, CT is looking to hire a Property Manager to manage our community of 235 apartments. The Property Manager will provide leadership, direction, and direct oversight of overall operations, delivering exceptional quality and services, ensuring a safe and attractive living environment for residents. The Property Manager will be responsible to manage revenue and expenses, build relationships and innovate ways to grow the business with the support of a customer service driven company. The position is ideal for those with an entrepreneurial spirit, and strategic ability to problem solve.

**Job Responsibilities**

* Conduct all business in accordance with company policies and procedures, Fair Housing, Americans with Disabilities Act, Fair Credit Reporting Act, and all other laws pertaining to apartments.
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with a strong bias towards customer service and managing resident relationships in an extremely professional and courteous manner.
* Attracts, retains, coaches, motivates, and leads a high-performance team and directs day to day operations; holds teams accountable for meeting all quality, safety, and other performance objectives.
* Interacts with prospective tenants, conducts tours, prepares, and signs leases, ensures that files are maintained properly, implements, and monitors effective lease renewal programs.
* Monitors the performance of the community; ensures effective execution of the marketing plan and achievement of occupancy goals.
* Stays informed regarding trends and best practices throughout the industry and of current events and conditions in the local markets; keeps management appropriately informed.
* Directly oversees the development and performance of operating budgets, vendor contracts & maintenance plans; provides timely coaching, direction, and corrective action to ensure achievement of plan objectives, financial targets, quality standards, sustained resident satisfaction and associate engagement.
* Monitors, reviews, and approves property expenses such as payroll, vendor invoices etc.
* Interacts with residents, agencies, vendors, and others to effectively resolve issues.
* Prepares, analyzes, monitors, and distributes reports on a variety of operational and financial data; responds appropriately based on results.
* Monitors the building, grounds, and surrounding areas to assess the physical condition of, maintenance, and capital improvement needs of the property.
* Coordinates, plans, and attends resident functions to enhance resident experience.
* Required to work one Saturday per month as part of the leasing office rotation.
* Other duties as assigned.

**Qualifications**

* Education: Bachelor degree (B. A.) from four-year college or university preferred.
* Minimum Experience: Six years conventional/market rate luxury multifamily on-site property management experience as a Property Manager.
* Must have background in supervision and successful track record of accomplishments.
* Ideal candidate will have experience in a family owned/operated company.
* Excellent communication, writing/composition, and interpersonal skills, highly analytical and organized with extreme attention to detail.
* Ability to work in an entrepreneurial fast-paced environment; multi-task while maintaining a strong attention to detail.
* Ability to work independently with minimal direction as well as with a team, prioritize, think critically and proactively, and meet critical deadlines.
* Experience with property management software – RealPage preferred.
* Must have a driver’s license. Car preferred.
* Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office.

Position is also eligible for an annual bonus, paid quarterly based on performance standards established by the company.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $80,000.00 - $100,000.00 per year

Work Location: In person

title: Member Service Representative/Personal Banker
description:
**Say Hello to Working on the Bright Side**



We are **Jovia Financial Credit Union**. Our name evokes a way of joy, a feeling of optimism, trust and “banking on the bright side”. We are a new kind of credit union, one that combines service and value with the convenience that today’s technologies allow. Our friendliness and energetic spirit make it easy to do business with us. At Jovia, our dynamic, fast growing culture awaits- come see for yourself.



Now with more than 3 billion in assets, 200,000 members, and 450+ employees, we attract the best and the brightest talent- who do the right thing, present a can-do spirit in a culture of fun, fulfilment, advancement and development. Find your joy here, every day.


**We give you:**


* Competitive compensation with paid training
* Open communication and an amazingly positive staff
* Managers who value input from their employees—we believe in you!
* A friendly, inviting work environment
* Work that feels like a second home with family events hosted by *Jovia*!
* Leaders who are involved, transparent and coach you
* Professional development and a perfect atmosphere for learning
* Fun social activities to nurture creativity and teamwork
* Business casual dress with annual corporate gear allowance!
* Great benefits – Med/Dent/401K/pension, and tuition reimbursement and more (Full Time employees)
* ***School Loan Repayment & Gym Reimbursement (Full Time employees)***
* Lots of growth and advancement potential
* Estimated Salary Range for this Position: $42,164-$49,605
* Jovia offers a variable compensation plan which allows employees an opportunity to earn up $3000
* A CEO with brilliant vision and aspiration


**Want to know why we’re so happy**? Click here to learn and meet our CEO!


**Find out what life at Jovia is like ...** https://www.jovia.org/life-at-jovia


**What you will be doing:**


* Direct dealing with member and potential members
* Support and promote a successful service/sales culture by identifying the needs of the membership and cross-selling the appropriate products.
* Efficiently and accurately process transactions (loan payments, transfer of funds)
* Research and resolve member concerns
* Sufficiently and accurately record information
* Efficiently utilize the software system provided to perform member transactions
* Engage with members to obtain information and explain available services to meet their financial needs.


**What we need from you:**


* Bachelor’s degree or minimum of 18 months of relevant experience in the financial industry or in a customer service
* Previous banking or financial services experience
* Desire to provide outstanding member service
* Ability to discuss products and services
* Professional appearance coupled with an enthusiastic, assertive personality.
* Self-motivated
* Strong computer skills
* Excellent communication skills
* Thorough knowledge of negotiable instruments
* Dependable (arrive to work on time as scheduled)


Be part of a growing not-for-profit organization where **People are Everything—You are important to us**. Help our members meet their financial goals and achieve their dreams. Let’s talk!


*At Jovia, we celebrate innovation, diversity, teamwork, excellence, and integrity. We are an equal opportunity employer and offer competitive compensation and benefits packages to recruit, retain, and reward top talent. We would like to be your partner in success and happiness!*


Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities


The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

title: Family Nurse Practitioner
description:
Overview:

We are seeking a dedicated Family Nurse Practitioner to join our healthcare team. The ideal candidate will provide primary healthcare services to patients of all ages, focusing on family-centered care and promoting overall wellness.

Duties:

- Conduct comprehensive health assessments and develop individualized care plans  
- Diagnose and treat acute and chronic illnesses for patients of all ages  
- Provide health education and counseling to patients and their families  
- Manage patient care in collaboration with physicians and other healthcare professionals  
- Perform procedures such as suturing, wound care, and minor surgical interventions  
- Prescribe medications and monitor patient responses  
- Utilize telehealth services to reach patients remotely  
- Implement infection control measures to ensure patient safety

Qualifications:

- Master's or Doctorate degree in Nursing from an accredited program  
- Current Family Nurse Practitioner certification  
- State licensure as a Nurse Practitioner  
- Experience in pediatric care, including PICU and neonatal ventilator management  
- Proficiency in acute care management, acute pain management, and family planning services  
- Knowledge of telehealth practices for remote patient consultations  
- Strong understanding of inpatient care protocols and procedures

Joining our team offers the opportunity to work in a collaborative healthcare environment that values patient-centered care. We provide competitive compensation, benefits packages, and opportunities for professional growth. If you are passionate about delivering high-quality healthcare services to diverse patient populations, we encourage you to apply for this rewarding position.

title: Shift Superintendent
description:
Apply now
**Date:** Sep 20, 2024


**Location:** Bayway, NJ, US, 07036


**Company:** Infineum


**About Us**
**We create a sustainable future through innovative chemistry.**
We are a Specialty Chemicals Company with powerful research and development capabilities around innovative chemistry which has a vital role to play in sustainability. We provide products needed on the journey towards the electrification of mobility, while helping to make the internal combustion engine as clean as it can be. As well as using our capabilities to generate sustainability advantages to countless new markets around the world.
**Infineum’s successes are built on the exceptional talents of our bright and highly skilled colleagues.**
In bringing together individuals from diverse backgrounds, cultures, and thinking styles, we have a culture where people with different talents, perspectives, and career experiences can flourish. We are looking for motivated people with an innovative mind-set to join us on our journey.
**Role Title:** Shift Superintendent
**Role Function and Group:** Supply& Operational Excellence / Manufacturing
**Location:** Bayway  


**Position Summary:**
Responsible for leading operations shift and delivering daily plant performance.  


**Key Outputs: What we can expect from you**
* This position works rotating 12 hour shifts on an "Every Other Weekend Off” (EOWEO) schedule
* Leads and promotes safety activities among shift team members including, but not limited to, Housekeeping, Last Minute Risk Assessments, Compliance to Life Saving Rules.
* Ensures entire shift meets all inventory and production targets
* Drives unit improvement initiatives, including operating efficiency and cost reduction
* Leads plant shift risk assessment activities, including considerations for daily operating tasks
* Needs to work effectively with numerous other organizations including maintenance, technical, HSSE and Phillips 66 Refinery.
* Improves the performance of the Components STL, Vis-J Console Supervisor and shift teams by establishing standards / goals for colleague performance and using effective coaching, coordination, and leadership.
* Meet internal/external customer needs and to develop and deliver improvements.
* Communicates work plans and status within the shift team, to shift relief, and to Production Manager and Business Unit Teams.
* Ensures shift teams complete and fully document all required tasks such as regulatory compliance checks, production entry, and maintenance work requests.
* Directly supervises Components STL and Vis-J Console Supervisor
* Incident command during emergency response
* Any additional responsibilities as assigned


**Skills a successful candidate is likely to have:**
* Motivate and lead their shift teams to execute planned production runs, prepare equipment for maintenance, and perform effective troubleshooting and root cause analysis.
* Manage multiple work items and set priorities for self and team
* Evaluate risk of non-routine and routine tasks performed by shift team


**Experience:**
* Demonstrated leadership capability
* Experience making risk-based decisions
* Significant manufacturing operations or maintenance leadership experience or Engineering Degree preferred

  


**Infineum is an Equal Opportunity Employer**

**Nearest Secondary Market:** Newark

title: Fixed Equip Maint Tech
description:
Apply now
**Date:** Sep 20, 2024


**Location:** Bayway, NJ, US, 07036


**Company:** Infineum


**About Us**
**We create a sustainable future through innovative chemistry.**
We are a Specialty Chemicals Company with powerful research and development capabilities around innovative chemistry which has a vital role to play in sustainability. We provide products needed on the journey towards the electrification of mobility, while helping to make the internal combustion engine as clean as it can be. As well as using our capabilities to generate sustainability advantages to countless new markets around the world.
**Infineum’s successes are built on the exceptional talents of our bright and highly skilled colleagues.**
In bringing together individuals from diverse backgrounds, cultures, and thinking styles, we have a culture where people with different talents, perspectives, and career experiences can flourish. We are looking for motivated people with an innovative mind-set to join us on our journey.
**Role Title:** Fixed Equipment Maintenance Technician
**Role Function and Group:** Supply / Maintenance / Fixed Equipment
**Location:** Bayway  


**Position Summary:**  

The Fixed Equipment Maintenance Technician will safely perform millwright work under general supervision.
This is a union position.  


**Key Outputs: What we can expect from you**  

* Read blueprints to determine work procedures, to construct foundations, assemble, dismantle and overhaul machinery and equipment using hoists, pulleys, dollies, rollers and trucks.
* Provide troubleshooting and analysis of pneumatic, steam, water and process systems.
* Familiar with hand and power tools (such as wrenches, pry bars, wedges, grinders, drills, band saws, pipe threading machines and dies). May be required to make customized parts or repairs.
* Must work within precise limits of accuracy at heights without fear.
* Must be able to use step-by-step procedures in work, planning, solving problems and decision making based on quantifiable information.
* A focus on millwright responsibilities may result in up to 25% of the job geared toward scaffold building.
* Any additional responsibilities as assigned.
  


**What skills will you gain from this role?**  

This is a great opportunity for the successful candidate to make a significant contribution to the Bayway Chemical Plant. This role will deepen skills in the area of Communication, Teamwork and Collaboration.  


**A successful candidate is likely to have:**  

* 5 years or more experience in power generation, refinery, chemical, pharmaceutical, paint/polymer, cosmetics, food or automotive industries.
* Thorough knowledge of load bearing equipment capabilities and understanding of blueprints and technical instructions.
* Strong pipefitting experience.
* Oxyacetylene cutting experience.
* Knowledge of fluid mechanics, hydraulic and pneumatics, and additional components involved in the process (such as valves, pumps, compressors and piping).
* Scaffold building experience including carpenter skills.
* Crane certification or operation is desired.
* Microsoft Outlook and basic computer skills preferred.
* SAP experience desired.
  


**Infineum is an Equal Opportunity Employer**

title: FS Transformation Capital Markets Consultant - Director
description:
**Industry/Sector**

Banking and Capital Markets
**Specialism**

Operations
**Management Level**

Director
**Job Description & Summary**

A career in our Customer Service practice, within Operations Consulting services, will provide you with the opportunity to help our clients optimise all elements of their operations to move beyond the role of a cost effective business enabler and become a source of competitive advantages. We focus on product innovation and development, supply chain, procurement and sourcing, manufacturing operations, service operations and capital asset programmes to drive both growth and profitability.
  

  

Our team helps organisations improve their customer interface, service delivery, and middle and back office operations. We use customer insights and market analytics to help our clients make smarter decisions, integrate products and services, and optimise their customer operations to enable sustainable growth.
To really stand out and make us fit for the future in a constantly changing world, each and every one of us at PwC needs to be a purpose-led and values-driven leader at every level. To help us achieve this we have the PwC Professional; our global leadership development framework. It gives us a single set of expectations across our lines, geographies and career paths, and provides transparency on the skills we need as individuals to be successful and progress in our careers, now and in the future.


As a Director, you'll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution. PwC Professional skills and responsibilities for this management level include but are not limited to:


* Support team to disrupt, improve and evolve ways of working when necessary.
* Arrange and sponsor appropriate assignments and experiences to help people realise their potential and support their long-term aspirations.
* Identify gaps in the market and spot opportunities to create value propositions.
* Look for opportunities to scale efficiencies and new ways of working across multiple projects and environments.
* Create an environment where people and technology thrive together to accomplish more than they could apart.
* I promote and encourage others to value difference when working in diverse teams.
* Drive and take ownership for developing connections that help deliver what is best for our people and stakeholders.
* Influence and facilitate the creation of long-term relationships which add value to the firm.
* Uphold the firm's code of ethics and business conduct.
