title: Banquet Houseperson Support/Banquet Set-Up
description:
**BANQUET HOUSEPERSON SUPPORT/BANQUET SET-UP**

**Hilton Pearl River**

500 Veterans Memorial Drive

Pearl River, NY 10965

www.hiltonpearlriver.com

**Hiring Rate: $16.50 - 16.75/hr**

Hilton Pearl River, a full-service luxury hotel located 25 minutes from New York City in Rockland County (NY) and bordering Bergen County (NJ), is seeking an organized, energetic, hands-on professional to join our exceptional team as Banquet Houseperson Support/Banquet Set-Up.

Hilton Pearl River remains an innovative forward-thinking hospitality leader by offering best-in-class products, services, and amenities to ensure that every guest feels cared for, valued, and respected. Banquet Support helps set up and tear down meeting rooms for events. This includes moving chairs, tables, and equipment from various rooms in the Banquet areas. Banquet Support helps bring our guests’ events to fruition. Whether it’s a business function, a wedding reception, or a birthday party, we strive to make our guests’ events the best ever! This position is full-time and must be able to work any shift.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

* Be responsible for physically setting up banquets & meeting rooms with tables, chairs, etc.
* Maintains appearance of meeting room and banquet areas, freshens rooms in use, breaks down and resets furniture arrangements as needed
* Stores all necessary equipment
* Frequent heavy lifting and movement of bulky and big furniture
* Vacuum, sweeps and mop floors, and public areas
* Sweep, scrub, polish, buff, wax, strip, or spot clean all floor surfaces, baseboard, walls, and wall hangings. Surfaces to be cleaned may include marble, terrazzo, tile, carpet, etc. This task requires heavy lifting, bending, stooping, or standing for extended period of time. Must be able push and pull heavy cleaning equipment, and furniture weighing up to 75 lbs
* Dust furniture, columns, shelves, etc. while extending arms over head or climbing ladders over 30 feet
* Use various cleaning techniques, and heavy shampooing equipment, to clean soiled carpet and upholstery
* Rotate mattresses and move furniture as assigned

In addition to performance of the essential function, this position may be required to perform a combination of the following supportive function:

* Respond to guest questions. Provide guest assistance, direction and information requested
* Patrol and remove debris, / trash from parking lot, sidewalks and front of the hotel entrance
* Other duties as assigned, such as assisting Room Attendants, delivery or retrieval of Housekeeping items to / from guest floors

Qualified candidates must be able to perform the essential functions of this position satisfactorily with or without a reasonable accommodation. *Disclaimer:* this job post is not necessarily an exhaustive list of all essential responsibilities, skills, tasks, or requirements associated with this position. While this is intended to be an accurate reflection of the position posted, Hilton Pearl River reserves the right to modify or change the essential functions of the job based on business necessity and at its sole discretion.

Education and Experience:

* High School graduate or equivalent required
* 0-1 year prior experience desired but not required
* Ability to learn and apply hazardous chemicals, standard during new hire introductory period
* Ability to read and understand Basic English language in order to understand the safety labels, equipment instructions etc
* Ability to speak English to communicate with guests and coworkers
* Ability to work any shift, any day including holidays and weekends
* We are an E-verify employer. Only those eligible to work in the United States need to apply

Please submit your resume' and cover letter. Only those candidates qualified will be contacted. Only those candidates that can work the required schedule will be contacted. We are an E-Verify employer and those who are able to work in the United States need apply.

Benefits:

* Hilton Team-Member Travel Program benefits
* Benefits after 30 days include sick & holiday pay, company-paid life insurance, option to enroll in medical plan
* Benefits after one year include vacation time and 401K participation

About the Hilton Pearl River

Hilton Pearl River is a third-generation family-owned and operated Hilton franchise built in 1988. The hotel is located on 17 wooded acres in the scenic Hudson River Valley, just 25 minutes from New York City, and has built and maintained a reputation for consistently exceptional service. The hotel consistently is awarded TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence award and has been ranked #1 in "Overall Service" of all Hiltons in New York, New Jersey, and Connecticut for nine of ten consecutive years. The property features 150 newly renovated guest rooms, restaurant, bar, and recreation facilities, as well as over 20,000 square feet of unique and flexible meeting and event space, and an experienced team of professionals committed to excellence.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer - M/F/H/D/V/T

EEO Statement:

Company is committed to providing equal employment opportunity and strictly prohibits all forms of unlawful harassment and discrimination based upon race, color, religion, gender, national origin, ancestry, age over 40, sexual orientation, transgender status, veteran status, marital status, mental or physical disability, medical condition or any other basis protected by law.

Notice to Recruiters and Agencies:

Company prefers to recruit candidates directly, rather than through a third party recruiter or agency. Do not submit or present your candidate(s) through any means (e-mail, fax, phone, mail, verbal referral) to the Company or any employee of the Company. In the case of candidate(s) submitted or presented to the Company by a recruiter or agency without a signed agreement in place for the specific position or without a specific open requisition, Company explicitly reserves the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency.

title: Job Placement Specialist
description:
**Apex Technical School**

**Position Summary**  
Are you looking for an opportunity to truly impact students' lives and help shape their careers? At Apex Technical School, we are seeking a Job Placement Specialistto guide students and graduates toward successful careers in their chosen trades. This role isn't just a job; it’s an opportunity to mentor, empower, and connect students with the industries they’re passionate about. Your efforts will play a crucial role in helping graduates launch their careers, giving them a chance to thrive and grow in their field.

As the Job Placement Coordinator, you will manage job orders, place students in suitable positions, and foster relationships with employers. You'll work closely with both students and employers to ensure successful placements, following up to maintain satisfaction. This is a role for someone passionate about seeing students succeed and motivated by building lasting professional relationships.

**What You’ll Do:**

* **Make an Impact:** Assist students and graduates in their professional development and employability skills to help them secure rewarding jobs in their trade.
* **Achieve Results:** Maintain a high placement rate by working closely with students, graduates, and employers to meet job placement goals.
* **Grow Relationships:** Build and maintain a network of employer connections to generate new job leads and placement opportunities.
* **Career Preparation:** Equip students and graduates with the latest job market information, helping them navigate job searches, salary expectations, and industry trends.
* **Ongoing Support:** Provide continuous follow-up with both employers and graduates to ensure a smooth transition into the workplace and to monitor long-term success.
* **Documentation**: Make sure students’ and graduates' interactions/progress are noted on spreadsheets and in database systems with detailed notes.

**Why Join Us?**

* **Career Advancement:** The Fedcap Group and Apex Technical School offers opportunities for growth and career advancement
* **Professional Development:** Gain invaluable experience in career services, recruitment, while developing your organizational, management, and communication skills.
* **Be a Mentor:** Have a direct influence on students' career journeys by preparing them for success and guiding them into meaningful roles.
* **Job Satisfaction:** Experience the rewards of helping students transition from the classroom to successful careers, knowing you’ve played a key role in shaping their futures.
* **Great Work Environment:** Enjoy a collaborative work setting where your efforts are recognized, valued, and essential to student success.

**Qualifications:**

· 2+ years of experience in Career Services, customer service, sales, or marketing.

· Strong communication and follow-up skills to manage relationships with employers and students.

· Ability to work independently and as part of a team including effectively following up and following through.

· Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel) and social media platforms.

· Previous job placement or recruitment experience is strongly preferred.

· Must be self-motivated, goal-oriented, and have a sense of urgency.

· Well-developed oral and written communication skills.

· Ability to handle a high-pressure environment with significant timeline pressures.

· Desire to help others be successful in finding employment.

· Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced work environment.

· Ability to serve as a role model for students and graduates.

· Ability to coach and provide guidance to students and graduates.

**Compensation:**

· $45,000 - $52,000, dependent upon experience. We offer a very competitive benefits package.

**Job Type:** Full-time

**Schedule:**

· 8-hour shift

· Day shift

· Evenings as needed

Join us at Apex Technical School and take on a role where you can truly make a difference. Help students achieve their dreams by connecting them with the careers they’ve trained for and watch them succeed in the trades.

**Apply Today!**

*Englewood Health, one of New Jersey’s leading hospitals and healthcare networks, delivers nationally recognized inpatient and outpatient care through its hospital and network of physician practices, urgent care centers, and imaging centers. Englewood Hospital, founded in 1890, consistently earns high marks for clinical excellence and patient safety. It is recognized as a 2022-23 Best Regional Hospital by US News & World Report, holds the Leapfrog Hospital Safety Grade ‘A’ (spring 2023), and was named a Leapfrog Top Teaching Hospital (2022). Englewood Hospital is nationally recognized for nursing excellence, earning a fifth consecutive designation by the Magnet Recognition Program in 2021. The Englewood Health Physician Network—a coordinated network of more than 600 office-based and hospital-based providers—offers primary care, specialty care, and urgent care at more than 140 locations in five counties across northern New Jersey. Areas of clinical excellence offered by the health system include cardiac surgery and cardiac care, cancer care, orthopedic surgery, primary care, spine surgery, vascular surgery, and women’s health, as well as bloodless medicine and surgery and minimally invasive robotic surgery. Englewood Health’s focus on health equity and population health encompasses outreach to underserved communities to enhance individual and public health, prevent disease, support lifelong wellness, reduce the burden of mental health challenges and substance use disorders, and meet the cultural, social, and holistic needs of specific populations. With its high-quality, culturally sensitive inpatient care, outpatient services, and community health and wellness programs, Englewood Health delivers a healthcare experience that puts patients at the center.*

title: Radiology Operations Manager (Float)
description:
Great opportunity to join our expanding practice and be part of our commitment to bringing empathy, compassion and a remarkable imaging experience to the communities we serve! Princeton Radiology Associates is a physician group practice currently providing diagnostic imaging services at 11 imaging centers and two hospitals throughout New Jersey and now Pennsylvania.

Princeton Radiology is currently seeking a full-time Radiology Operations Manager (Float) for our outpatient diagnostic imaging centers.

**Summary of Position:**

The Radiology Operations Manager (Float) will fill-in for all Radiology Operations Managers during absences and will plan, organize, direct, and control the daily administrative and clinical operations of assigned multi-modality outpatient diagnostic imaging centers. Responsible for assisting the Director of Radiology Operations with planning, staffing, performance management, communication, compliance with standards and regulations, customer service, quality initiatives, the application of mission and values, organizational improvement and projects.

**Responsibilities:** 

* Act as back-up to the Radiology Operations Managers at all outpatient diagnostic imaging centers, direct all imaging center activities to ensure smooth and efficient operations for front desk patient flow, patient care, and quality assurance.
* Supervise administrative staff and technologists and direct all staff activities including, coordinating schedules, reviewing and approving bi-weekly time cards.
* Oversee OSHA compliance and training for entire practice.
* Assist with hiring prospective employees in conjunction with Director and other managers.
* Develop, implement, and administer procedures and best practices to streamline processes for center operations.
* Assist with the development of goals and project plans in line with organization strategic plans.
* Assess all imaging centers performance through quality control, continuous quality improvement, procedure volumes, and other pertinent indicators of success.
* Ensure regular communication with internal and external customers within areas of responsibility. Convey issues to senior management timely and ensure direct reports are kept informed on organizational issues and developments.
* Resolve complaints from patients, referring physicians, radiologists, and organizational departments in a timely manner.
* Identify requirements and ensure compliance with the many accrediting bodies and regulatory agencies dealing specifically with diagnostic imaging practices including quality assurance, infection control, patient safety, radiation safety, and OSHA.
* Identify opportunities to enhance services provided to the community and all customers internal or external.
* Ensure imaging services are conveniently available to meet the needs of patients as determined by the medical staff; recommends and implements corrective action whenever necessary.
* Assist with the accreditation, use and maintenance of the equipment and facilities as needed.
* Initiate contact with referring physicians in order to maintain open lines of communication, solicit opinions and input regarding services being provided.
* Assist Director with developing controls and initiating audit tools to reduce or eliminate lost charges through the Radiology Information System.
* Ensure the PACS and RIS function of diagnostic imaging services is operating efficiently and providing the essential diagnostic information to all internal and external customers.
* Input VRad discrepancy information onto spreadsheet weekly, provide reports monthly to the QA Committee and quarterly to the Chief Operating Officer.
* Attend and participate in operations/manager meetings.
* Participate in and/or lead various projects as identified by management to support programs and initiatives.
* Contribute to and participate on various internal and external committees as appropriate or assigned.
* Continue personal and professional growth by staying abreast of technical developments in area of expertise.

**Qualifications:** 

* Graduate of an approved school of medical radiography.
* Minimum five (5) years recent work experience as a RT, RDMS or CNMT, with a passion to learn healthcare operations management. Management experience a plus.
* Must work at all imaging facilities when needed.
* Exhibit sound analytical ability, good judgment and strong operational focus.
* Demonstrates exceptional customer service and interacts effectively with physicians, patients, visitors, staff and the broader health care community.
* Exemplary organization, communication, project, and prioritization skills.
* Excellent written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills.
* Proven expertise in compliance and regulatory requirements.
* Self‐starter who is results focused, consistently able to meet critical deadlines and adapts well to change.
* Experience working with RIS and PACS preferred.
* Proficiency with MS Office applications (Word, Excel) and Internet.

Princeton Radiology offers competitive compensation with a comprehensive benefits package, featuring health, dental & vision insurance, company-paid life and long-term disability insurance, generous PTO (increases with years of service), sick time and 401k profit sharing plan with company match and profit-sharing contribution.

For more information regarding Princeton Radiology, visit our website at www.princetonradiology.com

title: Medical Receptionist Full Time Podiatry -Eduardo Glass
description:
Job Description
Medical Receptionist Full Time Podiatry -Eduardo Glass
**Req Id:** 61464
**Job Summary:**  

Under general supervision, and according to well defined policies and procedures, the MA/MR assists in the delivery of primary health and patient care management, interviews patients and/or patients’ representatives to obtain necessary personal, demographic, and financial information and identification. Performs routine clerical, secretarial and administrative work in answering telephones, receiving the public, providing customer assistance, data processing, computer data entry and other record keeping tasks related to the patients’ registration within the registration areas. This position assists with flow of patients from the waiting area to exam rooms and perform preparatory work on patients to ensure efficient use of the physician’s time. Experience with medical terminology and practice management systems preferred.


**Department:** HVA podiatry  

**Location:** Woodland Park  

**Status:** Full Time  

**Shift:** Days  

**Hours:** Varies


**Responsibilities include:**


1 – Greets all patients in a friendly and welcoming manner.


2 – Registers all patients in the EMR. Includes retrieval of all demographic, financial and insurance information from patients. Secures all necessary signatures on required forms.


3 – Obtains copies of patient identification and insurance identification and scans into document imaging system.


4 – Upon completion of registration, notifies the medical assistant that the patient is ready.


5 – Demonstrates effective communication skills with patients, visitors, co-workers and physicians in accordance with Service Excellence standards.


6 – Demonstrates appropriate and courteous telephone etiquette during telephone exchanges. Relays essential phone messages. Contacts physicians’ offices to exchange and gather information regarding patients.


7 – Schedules patients for appointments with the doctor and for testing as necessary.


8 – Preauthorizes testing and procedures as ordered by the doctor for the patient.


9 – Distributes incoming faxes and handles outgoing faxes.


10 – Performs all other duties as assigned.

  


**Qualifications**  

* Medical administrative support experience
* Patient service background
* Office experience, especially in a medical setting
* Proficiency in front desk duties
* Familiarity with EMR systems like Epic and eClinicalWorks
* Knowledge of HIPAA regulations
* Strong communication skills, including Spanish proficiency
* Excellent phone etiquette
* Understanding of medical terminology and records
  

  

**Education Requirements:**


* High School Graduate or Equivalent.
* Fluent in Spanish a must
  

  

*Englewood Health, one of New Jersey’s leading hospitals and healthcare networks, delivers nationally recognized inpatient and outpatient care through its hospital and network of physician practices, urgent care centers, and imaging centers. Englewood Hospital, founded in 1890, consistently earns high marks for clinical excellence and patient safety. It is recognized as a 2022-23 Best Regional Hospital by US News & World Report, holds the Leapfrog Hospital Safety Grade ‘A’ (spring 2023), and was named a Leapfrog Top Teaching Hospital (2022). Englewood Hospital is nationally recognized for nursing excellence, earning a fifth consecutive designation by the Magnet Recognition Program in 2021. The Englewood Health Physician Network—a coordinated network of more than 600 office-based and hospital-based providers—offers primary care, specialty care, and urgent care at more than 140 locations in five counties across northern New Jersey. Areas of clinical excellence offered by the health system include cardiac surgery and cardiac care, cancer care, orthopedic surgery, primary care, spine surgery, vascular surgery, and women’s health, as well as bloodless medicine and surgery and minimally invasive robotic surgery. Englewood Health’s focus on health equity and population health encompasses outreach to underserved communities to enhance individual and public health, prevent disease, support lifelong wellness, reduce the burden of mental health challenges and substance use disorders, and meet the cultural, social, and holistic needs of specific populations. With its high-quality, culturally sensitive inpatient care, outpatient services, and community health and wellness programs, Englewood Health delivers a healthcare experience that puts patients at the center.*

title: Business Development Associate
description:
**Why You're Important to Us:**



The Business Development Associate (BDA) role is essential within the sales organization at Wunderkind. Our BDAs are specialists in conducting in-depth research on prospects and finding innovative ways to set up meetings with decision-makers at our target accounts, largely top online retailers. You are responsible for initiating quality sales conversations that ultimately lead to new business, helping to scale revenue at Wunderkind. Your success *will not* be measured on daily activity metrics. Instead, you will be assessed based on monthly quota attainment and how well you demonstrate the Wunderkind core values.


**A Day In The Life:**


* Build and execute Account Based marketing plans through detailed research and highly customized, multi-channel outreach to key decision makers
* Prospect target accounts via multiple channels including referrals, email, social selling, gifting, corporate events, and more
* Act as the conduit between Sales, Marketing, and other relevant departments
* Assist Directors of Business Development (i.e. sales closers) in keeping prospects engaged throughout full customer sales lifecycle


**You Will Stand Out With:**


* 1+ years full time post grad work experience, preferably in sales or another client facing position
* An analytical, metrics-driven, and coachable mentality
* Passionate, driven, entrepreneurial self-starter with a healthy dose of humility and resourcefulness
* Strong research skills and ability to build natural relationships


**Bonus Points If You Have:**


* Prior selling experience in a similar BDA/SDR role preferably in the martech or Saas space however open to all backgrounds
* Passion and goal for long term sales career trajectory


*On the fence? Apply anyway! We know that imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting incredible candidates, and don't want it to get in the way of meeting you!*


**Learn More About Our Company, Culture and 5 Core Values:**


**DRIVE UNDENIABLE PERFORMANCE:**


* Wunderkind is a leading performance marketing engine that delivers tailored experiences at scale
* Digital businesses use Wunderkind to remember who users are better than ever before, allowing them to deliver high-performing, one-to-one messages on websites, through emails and texts, and in ads at a scale that's not otherwise possible.


**COME HUNGRY:**


* Driving $1.2 billion dollars annually in revenue for top eComm brands including Hugo Boss, Cole Haan, Fender, Rag & Bone, Gucci and more
* Incredible growth and promotion opportunities for top performing employees whether it be a leadership track or building out your own unique specialities


**CARRY EACH OTHER:**


* Unwavering commitment to culture, community, office events, and DEI initiatives
* Fully stocked snacks, beverages, and weekly sandwich bar or catered lunch
* Exceptional management training programs and internal opportunities for 1:1 Performance Acceleration Coaching


**BOUNCE BACK:**


* Company support and flexibility through all professional, personal, political, and world news and development
* Generous work life balance with 20 days PTO, 1 floating holiday, 14 National Holiday closures, Summer Fridays, 2 weeks of Newly-Wed PTO, Maternity & Paternity leave offerings


**RESPECT PEOPLE, PRIVACY, IDEAS:**


* Proud to be an equal opportunity and safe workplace
* Strongly committed to equal employment opportunities for all races, colors, ancestries, national origins, marital statuses, age, citizenship, disabilities, genders or gender identities, or Veteran status


*The base salary range for this role is $57,000 to $60,000. Actual compensation packages are based on several factors that are unique to each specific candidate; including but not limited to skill set, depth of experience, applicable certifications, and geographic work location. This may vary depending on living location and market rate.*

title: Maintenance / Entry Level Handy Person
description:
MAINTENANCE / ENTRY LEVEL HANDY PERSON  
Hilton Pearl River  
500 Veterans Memorial Drive  
Pearl River, NY 10965  
www.hiltonpearlriver.com

Hilton Pearl River, a full-service luxury hotel located 20 minutes from New York City in Rockland County (NY) and bordering Bergen County (NJ), is seeking an organized, energetic, hands-on professional to join our exceptional team as Maintenance/Entry Level Handy Person.

Hilton Pearl River remains an innovative forward-thinking hospitality leader by offering best-in-class products, services, and amenities to ensure that every guest feels cared for, valued and respected. Our Maintenance Tech will assist and participate in the repair, maintenance, and installation of all electrical, mechanical, plumbing, and architectural systems throughout the facility to ensure proper operation, safety, efficiency, and guest satisfaction. Candidates must be able to work the evening shift from 2:30 pm – 11:00 pm which includes weekends and holidays. This position also requires flexibility to work any shift any day.

Specific Job Knowledge, Skill, and Ability:

* Some knowledge desired with various building systems and some experience with at least some of these systems
* Some knowledge in order to troubleshoot issues in various building systems
* Some knowledge of plumbing and carpentry
* Ability to handle and prioritize multiple functions
* Ability to read, write, and speak conversational English.
* Excellent communication and human relations skills
* The ability to learn and understand building system plans including electrical, mechanical, and plumbing
* The ability to learn to analyze the design and performance of various building systems including electrical, mechanical, and plumbing
* Ability to perform duties in confined spaces and in awkward positions and in varying weather conditions and temperature
* Ability to remain calm in an emergency situation and to effectively deal with fellow team members and guests in such situations
* Ability to translate technical information or problems into more easily understandable terms

Qualified candidates must be able to perform the essential functions of this position satisfactorily with or without a reasonable accommodation. *Disclaimer:* this job post is not necessarily an exhaustive list of all essential responsibilities, skills, tasks, or requirements associated with this position. While this is intended to be an accurate reflection of the position posted, the Company reserves the right to modify or change the essential functions of the job based on business necessity and at its sole discretion.

* High School graduate or equivalent required
* Certified Pool Operator desired
* We are an E-verify employer. Only those eligible to work in the United States need to apply

Experience:

* Minimum of 1 year experience or other related industry experience in a generalist capacity, with hands-on experience desired
* Experience in hospitality or residential living industry preferred

Please submit your resume' and cover letter. Only those candidates qualified will be contacted. Only those authorized to work in the United States need apply. We are an E-Verify employer.

Compensation and Benefits:

* Compensation package
* Hilton Team-Member Travel Program benefits
* Benefits for all full-time team members after 30 days include sick & holiday pay, company-paid life insurance, option to enroll in medical plan, dental and vision plans
* Benefits after one year include vacation time and 401K participation

Please email resume with cover letter. Only those candidates with the requisite skills will be contacted.

About the Hilton Pearl River

Hilton Pearl River is a third-generation family-owned and operated Hilton franchise built in 1988. The hotel is located on 17 wooded acres in the scenic Hudson River Valley, just 25 minutes from New York City, and has built and maintained a reputation for consistently exceptional service. The hotel consistently is awarded TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence award and has been ranked #1 in "Overall Service" of all Hiltons in New York, New Jersey, and Connecticut for nine of ten consecutive years. The property features 150 newly renovated guest rooms, restaurant, bar, and recreation facilities, as well as over 20,000 square feet of unique and flexible meeting and event space, and an experienced team of professionals committed to excellence.

title: HR Business Partner Director
description:
LOCATION: New York City NY (hybrid – 8 days a month in the office)
OVERVIEW
You will be accountable for the performance and results for the human resources business partner function aligned to a line of business. You will be responsible for the Global Business Services Division globally. You will be a strategic human resources business partner providing expertise in leading-edge theories or techniques and guidance to the business on human capital strategy, needs, and decisions.
You will proactively identify and solve the most complex human capital problems that impact the management and direction of the business. You will lead the design, implementation, and monitoring of a variety of human resource programs. You will anticipate and plan for long-term human resource needs and trends in partnership with business management. You will lead multi-disciplinary projects and initiatives with visibility to senior management within the business and across the HR organization and interpret, execute, and recommend modifications to organizational policies.
You will be recognized as expert and thought leader by both internal and external community. Your advice has significant impact on strategic planning and business results. You may also provide leadership and guidance to a small team (1-2) of human resource professionals based on organizational scope, goals, and company direction.
RESPONSIBILITIES* Participate in division business planning and execution of programs; champions an enterprise culture of continuous improvement, ensuring the appropriate talent structure engagement model, performance management and recognition systems are in place to support the strategic objectives of the organization. Requires advanced communication and negotiation skills to modify the beliefs and opinions of important internal and external stakeholders.
* Provide strategic HR consulting, identifies key workforce challenges and employee and business priorities and is responsible for the development, execution, and management of the Human Capital plan for the business.
* Accountable for organization development and effectiveness for assigned businesses.
* Engaging CoE partners as appropriate, responsible to diagnose, identify scope of change and identify scope of change and identify interventions needed to improve organizational effectiveness.
* Designs future state changes (people, process, and structure), prepares change plans and works with leaders to implement. Drives effectiveness for assigned businesses.
* Demonstrate an understanding of the Legal and Finance functions. Ability to make quick decisions that mitigate risk but balances with courage to take smart risks based on experience.
* Coach senior management on complex employee relations and HR issues to include talent/performance goals and HR/talent implications of business decisions.
* Leverage and translate HR analytics to HR Business Partners, and business leaders regionally/globally, identifying trends, issues and opportunities.
* Provide leadership to senior managers or executives based on organizational goals and company direction.


QUALIFIC ATIONS
Education: Bachelor's degree in HR, Business, Industrial Relations, Organizational Development, or related field
Experience:* 12+ years of progressive HR experience.
* Proficiency with HR information systems, preferably Workday and the Microsoft Office Suite.
* Workers Council and Labor Law experience.
* People Management Experience.
* Previous experience working in a matrixed environment.


TRAVEL: May require travel (up to 25%); must be able to obtain and maintain valid travel documentation

Logistic Company in the High Fashion Industry is looking for a qualified candidate to fill the role of Customer Service Assistant. This is a support role that aids the Account Executive with data entry, cataloguing, and the execution of the day-to-day operations for the accounts that they manage.

Any complaints or concerns regarding unethical/unfair hiring practices should be directed to our Ombuds Group at **ombuds.person@wipro.com**
  

  

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, caste, creed, religion, gender, marital status, age, ethnic and national origin, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, political orientation, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.  

  

Wipro is committed to creating an accessible, supportive, and inclusive workplace. Reasonable accommodation will be provided to all applicants including persons with disabilities, throughout the recruitment and selection process. Accommodations must be communicated in advance of the application, where possible, and will be reviewed on an individual basis. Wipro provides equal opportunities to all and values diversity.

title: RDT (Registered Developmental Technician)
description:
**About Kinder Growth**  



At Kinder Growth we strive to support children with autism in building strong, meaningful, and enjoyable relationships with those around them. We work to support children in unlocking their potential to bring forth a happier and more engaged child.  



We take great pride in the Kinder Growth work environment. Our emphasis on employee happiness, growth, collaboration and communication are our guiding values when it comes to our staff. We recognize the value of our staff and their potential to contribute to our Kinder Growth team.  



Start your journey with us today!  


**Here’s what we’re looking for…**  



We are seeking playful and energeticRDTs to play with autistic youths. We work in the home or at school providing one to one DIRFloortime therapy sessions.
**Benefits Offered…**


* Flexible and part time hours, including evenings and weekends, with the availability to build a full time caseload.
* Career Advancement: Extensive support for those interested in advancing in an evolving field.
* Supervision: Regular direct supervision and mentoring by DIRFloortime credentialed professionals.
* Training: Meet with other RDTs under the supervision of clinical leadership for a monthly team meeting and training on various topics related to DIRFloortime.
* RDT training reimbursement
* No more than a 30 minute commute, with client-to client mileage reimbursement.
* Full time employees: Health Insurance.

  


**Here’s what your role as a** **RDT** **may look like...**  


* Work under the supervision of an AFT (Advanced Floortime Player) or QHP (Qualified Healthcare Provider).
* "Befriending" the youth.
* Playing 1:1 to support the child in development
* Video your session to reference back to when reflecting on sessions.
* Light data collection.
* Use positive, affective approaches to create meaningful change.

  


**Requirements:**
* Bachelors Degree and 1 year related experience or education (Education, Counseling, Psychology, Sociology, Developmental Intervention, RBT/ Behavior technician)
* Valid form of ID
* Pass Federal and State background checks
* Must have reliable transportation
* Ability to play on the floor
* Working device to take session data and video sessions

  


**COVID-19 Precautions:**
* Remote interview process
* Virtual meetings


**Job Types:**
* Full-time, Part-time


**Pay:**
* $25 per hour


**Education:**
* Bachelor's (required)


**Experience (1 year required):**
* Child care (babysitting, daycare, paraprofessional, preschool teacher, assistant teacher)
* Special education (educational settings, special needs)
* Developmental intervention (early intervention)
* Autism interventions (RBT/ Behavioral technician, Autism support specialist, ABA therapist, RDT, other DIRFloortime experience)


**Work Location:**
* Multiple Locations

description:

title: Maintenance/ Porter
description:
Building porters make sure that buildings are in clean and functioning order for their occupants. In large facilities, such as factory complexes or hotels, they may work in teams, while in small apartment buildings, a porter may be the only cleaning and maintenance person. Duties of a house porter may include general upkeep and carrying luggage for visitors.
  
  

Porters sweep and mop hallways, vacuum carpets, clean bathrooms and order cleaning supplies. Maintenance porter job descriptions also require knowlege of power tools to do minor repairs such as fixing leaky faucets or changing bulbs. For major problems, they inform management. Porters typically work when buildings are unoccupied, such as during evenings or weekends.

title: Chief Estimator - Building - 15 yrs experience
description:
**Description:**

As a Chief Estimator, you'll lead the estimating team and oversee budget creation for all projects. You’ll be responsible for setting standards, managing the estimating process, and analyzing past project performance to improve future estimates. Working closely with management, you’ll ensure consistency in deliverables, bid packages, and budgeting tools while coordinating resources and managing the team to handle a variety of project types, including Design-Build.

Your role includes assigning team responsibilities, reviewing project plans, managing bids, analyzing risks, and preparing budgets. You’ll also collaborate with other departments, ensure project information is accurate, and build strong relationships with clients, suppliers, and contractors. Additionally, you’ll provide ongoing support to project teams after successful bids and participate in client and community engagement.

**Qualifications:**

A Bachelor’s in Civil Engineering, Construction Management, or a related field and 15+ years of experience with large projects ($200M+). Proficiency with estimating software (Timberline, OST, Revit) and strong MS Office skills are essential. You must have excellent communication, organizational, and analytical skills, be detail-oriented, and able to work under pressure. The role requires flexibility with travel, meeting deadlines, and upholding company standards.

title: Director of Marketing, US
description:
**About TodayTix Group:**  

TodayTix Group, TTG, is the global e-commerce leader for cultural experiences. Founded in 2013, TTG designs frictionless e-commerce experiences via innovative product design and industry-leading technology.  

Through powerful consumer matchmaking technology and our expansive portfolio of brands, including TodayTix, ttg:digital, New York Theatre Guide, London Theatre Guide, and Secret Cinema, TTG has an intimate understanding of its millions of customers. We optimize partner relationships by providing unparalleled access to engaged audiences to generate meaningful revenue, transforming the way tickets are sold. With an ever-expanding global network of theatres, producers, and cultural institutions, frictionless technology, and vast data and insights, TTG is at the forefront of the digital transformation of culture.  

We are seeking outstanding applicants of all backgrounds to join our team to bring new voices, talent, and perspectives to the table. We encourage all to apply. **About the Role:**  

TodayTix is seeking a strategic and results-oriented Director of Marketing, US, to oversee all aspects of paid and unpaid, attributable and unattributable, brand-focused, and product-focused marketing for our US markets, with a particular emphasis on New York (Broadway). The ideal candidate has extensive experience scaling paid channels efficiently and developing impactful, integrated and highly strategic marketing campaigns, and excels at driving brand awareness and achieving ambitious growth goals. A deep understanding of the dynamic and competitive Broadway market, in addition to the regional North American theatre market, is a plus.  

Reporting directly to SVP Marketing, TodayTix, you’ll be responsible for achieving ambitious channel-level targets and creating marketing campaigns that align with TodayTix’s business objectives. This is a highly collaborative role, as this person will work closely with Brand Marketing, Partner Success and Product/Tech teams on a daily basis, in addition to getting the best from teams reporting directly to them, including CRM.  

This is a fantastic opportunity for a marketing leader who has a proven track record of driving growth and creating engaging campaigns across traditional marketing channels, digital, and social media. If you are passionate about the performing arts space, consider yourself highly creative and innovative, and are focused on delivering against ambitious goals and KPIs, then we’d love to hear from you! **Please note:** this is a full-time position and qualified candidates must be based in the greater New York City area. We encourage collaboration by working a minimum of 2 days per week in the office, while also offering flexibility for employees to choose where they work for the rest of the week.
### **What You'll Do:**

* Develop powerful, compelling and successful year-round marketing strategies for TodayTix US, designed to take advantage of business opportunities to ensure TodayTix achieves its annual growth goals in the market.
* Plan and execute industry-leading marketing campaigns incorporating both performance and non-performance media, ensuring synchronization across all marketing channels. Challenge team members and channel teams to provide energetic and market-leading solutions to specific challenges.
* Take overall responsibility for TodayTix’s US marketing budget of $16M+ pa
* Direct the growth team (Google and Meta) to achieve agreed goals representing both scale of business (including gross sales, ticket volume, first purchase) but also efficiency (including CPI, CPA and CAC), actively pushing teams towards success. Ensure the team is continually challenged and stay abreast of trends, changes and algorithm and channel issues.
* Partner with the Director of Brand to lead on the budgeting and execution of TodayTix brand campaigns, especially regarding ensuring the effectiveness of campaigns, as well as comms goals and PR strategy.
* Develop comprehensive campaign plans for high-impact multi-show campaigns throughout the year, utilizing them to achieve TT goals. Share responsibility for campaign success with the Partner Success team.
* Provide effective line management and clear direction for the marketing team, ensuring robust and well-executed activities that highlight key brand benefits and compelling product.
* Oversee US email marketing calendars, considering the diverse needs of different business corners, including Partner Success and Brand teams.
* Advocate for TT’s Members’ perspective in all planning and campaign execution, ensuring that all activities continually clarify the USPs of TTG’s brands and strengthen their consumer proposition.
* Champion the adoption of innovative technologies and data-driven approaches within the marketing strategy, collaborating with tech and product teams to leverage cutting-edge tools that enhance overall campaign effectiveness. Ensure a seamless user/Member experience that aligns with the company's brand promise and marketing objectives.
* Represent TTG to the broader industry, showcasing the integrity, spirit of partnership, resourcefulness, and resilience of the TTG team.
* Work with the Partner Success team to shape and deliver compelling promotional offerings, representing the needs and wishes of TodayTix Members
* Steer activities in the organic social space, partnering with Brand team to deliver compelling content that resonates with both existing and new TodayTix Members.

### **We're Looking for Someone With:**

* 10+ years of experience in an integrated marketing role, where they have been adept at drawing together disparate campaign elements to achieve a unified goal; app marketing experience a strong plus
* Experience of planning and taking responsibility for multi-million dollar advertising campaigns, utilizing a blend of performance and non-performance media. Comfortable in advocating for media choices and continually pushing the boundaries for reach and impact
* A track record of deep curiosity and fervor around the businesses and products they’ve marketed; regardless of industry background, a desire to become an expert in understanding the theatrical landscape
* A strong creative gut around visual and verbal creative and experience giving feedback and direction to creative teams to elevate work to excellence
* Knowledge of growth marketing strategies and tactics; comfortability in managing to CAC targets with an understanding of how to direct media budgets to balance scale and profitability
* Ability to work to sales goals, with a proven track record of turning a range of data into market insight, market insight into marketing strategy, and marketing strategy into successful execution. This role will be expected to have a keen understanding of how the product we sell contributes to overall business performance and to have a sophisticated point of view on where and how the TodayTix brand leans into show-specific versus brand-led marketing.
* Ability to gain partnership across an organization, exercising authority and influence to keep wheels in motion
* Experience managing a team of high performers, with a demonstrated record of holding teams to high standards, motivating with urgency, and leading with empathy

*Salary ranges are determined by competitive market data for our size, stage, and industry, experience and location of the applicant, and our internal salary banding, which is reviewed at least annually.* *We aim to be as transparent, equitable, and fair as possible. Qualified candidates and our Talent Acquisition team will discuss salary and benefits in the initial conversation, and final salary will be determined after candidates complete the interview process. We expect that the majority of candidates who are offered roles at TTG fall healthily throughout the range based on the above factors.* *To learn about the Perks and Benefits outside of the salary, please check out our "Good to Know" section!* **Good to Know:**  

TodayTix Group takes care of our team. We’re proud to offer a generous suite of benefits and perks. Here are a few of our favorites:* Hybrid work environment (minimum 2 days per week in office)
* Healthcare, vision, and dental plans, with generous contributions from the company
* Life and disability insurance
* Paid Parental Leave
* Generous 401(k) Matching
* Flexible Paid Time Off
* Free membership to One Medical Group & Employee Assistance Program
* Annual Professional Growth Budget
* Employee donation matching
* Employee Referral Program
* Work From Home budget
* Pre-Tax Flexible healthcare spending account (FSA), Dependent Care FSA and Commuter Benefits

  

TodayTix Group is committed to creating a diverse and equal workforce. Our aim is to create an inclusive and diverse environment which reflects the world we live in, as well as making a positive impact regarding diversity and accessibility within our industry. We highly encourage applications from all, regardless of race, age, gender, gender identity, nationality, ethnic origin, disability, religious belief, or sexual orientation.  

For information on our US employee and applicant privacy policy, click here. For more information about the data we collect and retention periods, please see our Data Collection Notice here.

title: Pre-Owned Sales Consultant
description:
Located on a 330,000 square foot lot on 11th Avenue between 53rd and 54th Streets, Mercedes-Benz Manhattan is the only Mercedes-Benz dealership in the country owned and operated by Mercedes-Benz, delivering an uncompromising inventory of new and pre-owned Mercedes-Benz luxury vehicles and Sprinter Vans. We are the trusted dealership for drivers throughout New York and beyond.

The mission of the Mercedes-Benz Manhattan Pre-Owned Sales Consultant is to provide superior customer service while selling pre-owned Mercedes-Benz vehicles.

The Mercedes-Benz Manhattan Pre-Owned Sales Consultant must provide a consistently outstanding brand and customer experience through consistently outstanding preparation, attitude, and teamwork.

**Responsibilities**

* Respond to customer inquiries regarding the lease/purchase of a new/pre-owned Mercedes-Benz vehicles.
* Maintain customer satisfaction by confirming orders with customers, sending written communications for timely transactions.
* Assist customers with all aspects of vehicle ownership, including but not limited to scheduling service appointments, assisting with lease maturities, acting as a liaison for Collision Center inquiries, following up on DMV issues, procuring any and all missing documentation for financing, and supplying Sales Managers with accurate order status.
* Calculate lease and purchase options for customer and quote accurate
* payments.
* Follow up with customers to obtain referrals and repeat business.
* Sell/lease as many vehicles as required by MBM’s annual minimum
* standards.
* Maintain/update customer information in company databases.
* Maintain a clean and safe work area.
* Able to commute into and out of Manhattan/New York City on a daily basis.

**Qualifications**

* High School Diploma (GED) or equivalent work experience.
* Must have a minimum of 3 years Pre-Owned Sales experience
* Valid Driver's License.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $80,000.00 - $180,000.00 per year

Experience:

* Automotive Pre-Owned Sales: 3 years (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Account Follow-Up Representative II
description:
The Account Follow-up Representative II is responsible for the review and resolution of outstanding insurance balances on hospital patient accounts. The Account Follow-up Representative II is required to learn multiple hospital systems, conduct research analysis, utilize intermediate skills to work basic to complex outstanding insurance claims, work closely with third party payors to answer relevant questions and obtain appropriate information in pursuit of resolving unpaid claims.
Primary Duties:* Timely follow-up on hospital patient accounts that are outstanding for insurance payment, including but not limited to the following processes: verify claim payment status, rebill to patient’s insurance, proration to correct financial class and notation of patient accounts with steps taken for resolution
* Work an average of 40-50 accounts per workday for assigned payor(s)
* Assigned Payor denials and Zero ($0) pay reports worked within 24 hours of receipt
* Gather additional demographic, clinical information, medical records, authorizations, and insurance related information deemed necessary to pay outstanding medical claims and update the applicable systems with the patient’s information
* Ability to prioritize job responsibilities and manage time effectively for completion of assignments
* Analyze, communicate, and participate in resolving denial/variance trends and payor issues with other teams/departments within the organization
* Identifies and prepares less complex claims for reconsiderations and appeals
* Assists leadership in managing assigned A/R and ensure resolution of outstanding insurance balances at 90 days post discharge
* Works closely with third party payors and takes next steps to reach resolution of outstanding insurance balances.
* Must have the ability to deliver education and training for new hires along with assisting less experienced representatives.
* Perform research on patient accounts with outstanding insurance balances and route patient accounts through appropriate workflows
* Review and recommend adjustments to accounts in accordance with payor, company, and client guidelines
* Participate and complete projects assigned by team lead or manager to fulfill clients’ contractual agreement of services
* Work in partnership with other teams/departments regarding resolution of project issues, concerns, and workflows
* Complete assigned LinkedIn learning path within the calendar year
* Attend role-based education courses within the calendar year
* Assists leadership with special projects and/or stretch assignments
* Other duties as assigned


Administrative Duties:* Accurately input/submit worked time by the required departmental deadlines
* Maintain knowledge of insurance payors and collection regulations
* Maintain industry knowledge through self-study and by attending training classes
* Attend and participate in team and departmental meetings
* Effectively responds to emails, telephone calls, voicemails, Microsoft Teams messages, and correspondence from patients, agencies, and facilities in a timely manner
* Adherence to all HIPAA Privacy and Security requirements and responsibilities
* Perform duties and responsibilities in a positive manner that upholds company policies and procedures


Other Skills:* Knowledge of revenue cycle processes impacting insurance reimbursements
* Knowledge of the insurance follow-up processes with understanding of the fundamental concepts in healthcare reimbursement methodologies
* Solid understanding of Institutional (UB04) and Professional (1500) claim forms required
* Use critical thinking skills and payor knowledge to recommend system edits/updates to reduce denials and result in prompt and accurate payment
* Proficiency with telephone systems for outbound/inbound calls
* Access protected health information (PHI) in accordance with departmental assignments and guidelines
* Skilled in making accurate arithmetic computations
* Excellent communication, good judgment, tact, initiative, and resourcefulness
* Must be detail oriented, organized, and ability to multi-task
* Possess ability to concentrate for long periods of time
* Ability to work individually and/or as part of a team
* Ability to demonstrate supportive relationships with peers, clients, partners, and corporate executives
* Must be flexible with a “can do” attitude and the ability to remain professional under high pressure situations
* Demonstrates the ability to learn new systems quickly and develop proficient operating skills within a reasonably short timeframe
* Understand both oral and written directives


Training and Experience:* High School or equivalency diploma required
* 0-3 years’ experience in related field (recent graduate of Medical Billing and Coding coursework accepted in lieu of experience)
* Must be able to follow directions and to perform work according to department standards independently
* Must be emotionally mature and able to function effectively under high pressure situations
* Sufficient in Microsoft Office applications (i.e., Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.) to complete work assigned
* Customer Service oriented


Other Requirements:* High Speed Internet access and unlimited data
* Smart phone for DUO authentication
* Negative pre-employment drug tests
* Criminal and MVR backgrounds meet our company hiring criteria


Salary:* $26/hr

title: Director of Development
description:
Reporting to the Head of School, the Director of Development will plan, implement and oversee the organization’s advancement efforts, including major gift, annual fund, endowment and capital campaigns. He or she will create and formalize an engagement strategy for parents, grandparents, alumni, and stakeholders of Manhattan Day School (MDS).  



The Director of Development will work closely with lay leaders and appropriate administrators to devise and formulate plans and then implement them. He or she will need excellent communication skills, both written and verbal as well as the ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and volunteers. Since this may be a one person operation, the ability to bring in and work with partners will be very important.  



Responsibilities include the following:* Creation and execution of strategic plan for development and alumni and grandparent/family relations efforts for MDS including setting realistic and measurable goals.
* Identify, cultivate, solicit, and steward individual donors, for expendable as well as capital and endowment gifts.
* Responsible for managing all development activities for the Head of School.
* Drive strategy and planning for events; including but not limited to:
+ Annual fundraising dinner, the selection and solicitation of honorees, overseeing logistics of the dinner, and working with relevant volunteer committees; and
+ Cultivation events, including parlor meetings with major stakeholders, grandparent events and alumni programming.

* Work with School’s leadership and Board members, including jointly staffing the board, parent’s council, and engaging lay leaders around development activities.
* Create strategy for and execute any future comprehensive/capital campaigns for MDS.
* Working with appropriate staff and lay leaders, and spearhead the selection and implementation of a Contact Relationship Management database.

  


Salary commensurate with experience in the range of $130,000 - $150,000.

If interested, please send resume and cover letter to resumes@manhattanday.org

title: Phlebotomist - WEEKENDS only
description:
Responsible for the accurate, timely performance of venipuncture and/or capillary specimen collection to obtain quality laboratory results. Screen and enter patient data into the Laboratory computer system and central computer systems. Serves patients by preparing specimens for laboratory testing; performing screening procedures.

Phlebotomists may collect blood and receive urine samples from patients, but may not choose which tests are to be performed nor perform any tests or procedures with these samples. Phlebotomists take or send specimens to the laboratories that will do all tests and other procedures, prepare and send a report of their findings to the authorized health care practitioner who will use them in rendering a diagnosis and recommending treatment.

Phlebotomist Job Duties:

· Verifies test requisitions by comparing information with nursing station log; bringing discrepancies to the attention of unit personnel.

· Verifies patient by reading patient identification.

· Obtains blood specimens by performing venipunctures and fingersticks.

· Maintains specimen integrity by using aseptic technique, following department procedures; observing isolation procedures.

· Collects therapeutic drug-monitoring assays by collaborating with nursing personnel to ensure appropriate drug dose to collection time.

· Tracks collected specimens by initialing, dating, and noting times of collection; maintaining daily tallies of collections performed.

· Monitors glucose levels by performing bedside glucose tests; recording results; reporting results to unit nurse-manager.

· Performs bleeding-times tests by entering results to the computer; notifying pathologist of results falling outside normal ranges.

· Maintains quality results by following department procedures and testing schedule; recording results in the quality-control log; identifying and reporting needed changes.

· Maintains safe, secure, and healthy work environment by following standards and procedures; complying with legal regulations.

· Resolves unusual test orders by contacting the physician, pathologist, nursing station, or reference laboratory; referring unresolved orders back to the originator for further clarification; notifying supervisor of unresolved orders.

Job Type: Full-time

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $16.00 per hour

Expected hours: 14 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid sick time
* Paid time off
* Paid training
* Vision insurance

Medical Specialty:

* Pathology

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

License/Certification:

* Certified Phlebotomy Technician (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Front Office Trade management Consultant
description:
**Position: Front Office Trade management Consultant** 

**Location: New York ,NY (Onsite role)**

Note : Role is a Techno Functional role. Technical BA or Front Office Trade management Support Consultant.

Incumbant needs to have good experience into Front Office side of Trade management.

* Located within the trade floor and facing-off directly to traders, quants, quant developers, salespeople and relationship managers, this a varied role working on a multitude of market-leading technologies to support the running of Liquidnet s bespoke trading platform.
* The role is ultimately responsible for support duties across the Liquidnet, CoEx and ICAP RV businesses and production systems used for Equities and Exchange-Traded Derivatives asset classes.

\\*

* Demonstrable experience within the listed derivatives markets with a strong understanding of trading and clearing workflows.
* 5 years hands-on support experience within a financial institution (buy-side, sell-side, venue/platform provider)
* Strong working knowledge of Fidessa GTP or equivalent systems Proactive, tenacious individual with ability to solve complex issues.
* Creative and enthusiastic approach to new or existing challenges
* Willingness to challenge the status quo and bring about positive change
* Capable of balancing multiple conflicting priorities and managing stakeholder expectations honestly and appropriately
* Demonstrable working knowledge of the FIX protocol
* Application support experience within a Unix / Linux environment
* Familiarity of MSSQL, Oracle or Sybase database environments, including query-writing
* Experience of supporting Windows Server environments
* Experience in troubleshooting basic network problems: i.e. firewall and routing problems. Good working understanding of python, PERL and/or bash scripts
* With a strong emphasis on the support of the listed derivatives business, the role encompasses daily support of the platform, configuration of new and existing client requests and testing new functionality prior to release to members, ultimately acting as the gatekeeper for the front office production environment.
* Responsibilities Located within the front office, provide support to client-facing business teams (Trade DeskTrade Coverage) and clients, performing diagnosis of revenue-generating issues and routine tasks, escalating to Platform Services Implementation/Development where appropriate.
* First responders to all client-related support issues, escalating to other internal support or development teams where required.
* Support Liquid net Listed Derivatives, including Fidessa GTP, interfaces for various E/OMS vendors and direct access FIX interfaces.
* Respond to monitoring alerts pertaining to trading systems (execution DKs, order rejections, breaches of risk controls etc) Incident managements for front office issues Assist with product testing and project work. Contribute towards follow the sun support model, working closely with global teams in APAC and US to ensure pre-market health checks are performed for each region. Performing regional start of day health checks to ensure all processes are up and members are connected to the platform. Occasional weekend work will be required during major upgrades and out of hours testing.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $55.00 - $60.00 per hour

Ability to Commute:

* New York, NY (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Laboratory Aide
description:
**Job description**
-------------------

  



We are looking for a Laboratory Aide to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in laboratory science. This position requires the ability to accurately analyze and interpret test results, maintain laboratory equipment, and provide technical assistance to other medical staff. The successful candidate will also be responsible for ensuring that all laboratory protocols are followed and that quality control measures are in place.



Responsibilities:


* All tasks performed under direct supervision of senior laboratory technologists and laboratory supervisor.
* Learn and follow lab specific procedures and policies
* Provide a customer service experience to end users and collaborate to ensure objectives are completed in a timely manner.
* Knowledge of laboratory instrumentation pipettes, balances, centrifuges, and other equipment.
* Perform routine preventative maintenance on lab equipment
* Troubleshoot equipment issues
* Be a Subject Matter Expert on equipment issues to resolve problems and reduce downtime.
* Complete safety trainings and follow established laboratory policies.
* Order and stock consumable inventory.
* General maintenance
* Work cross-functionally with different departments to drive efficiency.
* Assume responsibility and accountability for the performance of clinical laboratory testing that pertains to patient care and diagnosis.
* Performs routine and special laboratory procedures, quality control, preventative maintenance, minor equipment repairs, inventory control, and statistical compilation
* Participates in quality assurance, performance improvement, laboratory education, new employee training and proficiency testing when assigned.


Education and Experience requirements:


* Current knowledge of clinical laboratory techniques and principles.
* Bachelor degree in Medical Laboratory Technician studies, or a chemical, physical or biological science degree. (Will consider 3rd / 4th year students with a minimum of 65 credits in chemistry/biology/life sciences)


Job Type: Part-time



Pay: $18.00 - $20.00 per hour



Schedule:

  


* Monday to Friday
* Night shift

  



Shift availability:

  


* Night Shift (Required)

title: ITS Architect and Project Coordinator
description:
Job description

### **Business type**


Types of Jobs - IT, Digital et Data### **Job title**


ITS Architect and Project Coordinator
### **Contract type**


Permanent Contract### **Job summary**


Summary  

  

* The ITS Technical Coordinator is in charge of providing support to the Chief Technical Officer (CTO) / Head of ITS by:
* Providing technical expertise on Architecture schemes and decision for the ITS (IT Production Services – Infrastructure) department
* Manage and provide expertise for key ITS Project deliveries for the Bank

  

GIT ITS Americas Department Overview  

* ITS stands for Information Technology Production Services
* IT Production Services is in charge of both Run the Bank (RTB) and Change the Bank (CTB) activities related to all of Americas IT Infrastructure.
* ITS is in-charge of the design and production of infrastructures, the production of GIT applications, the setup of technical security systems and backup plans.
* ITS supports users (~1200) and systems of 11 sites throughout the Americas.
* The technical infrastructure spread across three data centers, two in New Jersey and a smaller footprint in the New York office.


The technologies used encompasses core infrastructures (Systems, Storage, Database, Network, and Security), end user services (Citrix, VDI, and communication services), Monitoring Tools and applications and associated infrastructure (middleware platforms such as Control-M, MQ, CFT, Connect-Direct).
  

  

Key Responsibilities  

  

* Architecture related activities:
* Be knowledgeable of the Bank Infrastructure layers (with a focus on network but not only)
* Design architecture schemes for ITS projects for US and Americas region
* Review architecture design provided by our Head Office
* Be a SPOC (Single point of Contact) for Americas for Head office to ITS topics.
* Continuous improvement for ITS setup within Americas
* To answer to Audit questions internal and external including regulators
* Partner and coordinate with ISS department on ITS solutions

  

* Project management related activities: acting as Project Manager / PMO on ITS projects:
* This includes, when applicable, change management activities (including roles and responsibilities, creation of service level agreements, review of current processes, definition of target processes and organization…); project scoping, planning and monitoring; define risk analysis on the different IT activities involved in the IT projects; organization of training as well as User Acceptance Testing.
* Define, communicate & support standards across local Global IT division in line with System Product Life Cycle and Global GIT project management methodology.
  

#LI-DNI
### **Supplementary Information**


Key Responsibilities Continued:* Ensure adherence to the System Project Life Cycle (SPLC) and produces or assists in the production of key deliverables defined by the SPLC.
* Implements and develops improvements based on LEAN-CA-CIB best practices
* Organize working, project and steering committees.
* Ensure that all system implementations meet US regulatory standards (inclusive of cybersecurity requirements) and done in accordance with the Bank’s policies and procedures.
* Collaborate with NY Internal Auditors in their pre-implementation review.

* Assist and provide expertise to CTO for any strategic or key requests


Management and Reporting  

This position will report directly to the CTO of the Bank (Head of the ITS department)  

Key Internal contacts  

Any business line involved in projects.
GIT Head Office and ISS technical teams (and their architects)  

Key External contacts  

Any external provider involved in projects as well as the Head Office.
Salary Range: $150k - $190k

Position location

### **Geographical area**


America, United States Of America### **City**


NEW YORK
Candidate criteria

### **Minimal education level**


Bachelor Degree / BSc Degree or equivalent### **Academic qualification / Speciality**


* Must be a bachelors’/engineering graduate


### **Level of minimal experience**

11 years and more### **Experience**


* Minimum 10-12 years of experience in managing Network/Security or Infrastructure environment with about 3-5 years of experience in financial institutes


### **Required skills**


Technical expertise on architecture layouts for network  

Infrastructure experience (Build, Run)  

Project Management on IT Infrastructure projects
### **Technical skills required**

  

Microsoft Office Suite, specifically Excel, Visio, Power Point, Word  

Soft skills:
o Strong written and verbal communication skills
o Good organizational skills with attention to detail
o Multi-tasking
o Ability to analyze and summaries information
o Ability to work autonomously
o Comfortable in working with multiple teams across locations with excellent inter-personal skills.
Other:
o Organization, delegation, ability to provide technical guidance.
o Budgeting.  

Familiar with information systems functional and business processes

title: Account Executive Hospice
description:
Overview  


Amedisys, one of the largest and most trusted home health and hospice companies in the U.S., is looking for a hospice liaison to join the team. The ideal candidate for this role will have experience in outside sales/business development in the healthcare industry. A background in cold calling customers in pharmaceuticals, medical device sales, hospital, home health, hospice or long-term care is ideal.

**Attractive pay*** Salary: $80,000 - $85,000 plus bonus potential


**Territory*** Bergen and Passaic County


**Enjoy many perks and benefits*** A full benefits package with choice of affordable PPO or HSA medical plans.
* Paid time off.
* Up to $1,300 in free healthcare services paid by Amedisys yearly, when enrolled in an Amedisys HSA medical plan.
* Up to $500 in wellness rewards for completing activities during the year. Use these rewards to support your wellbeing with spa/massage/salon services, gym memberships, fitness classes, sports, hobbies, pets and more. \\*
* Mental health support, including up to five free counseling sessions per year through the Amedisys Employee Assistance program.
* 401(k) with a company match.
* Family support with infertility treatment coverage\\*, adoption reimbursement, paid parental and family caregiver leave.
* Fleet vehicle program\\*\\* and mileage reimbursement.
* And more.


*Please note: Benefit eligibility can vary by position depending on shift status.** *To participate, you must be enrolled in an Amedisys medical plan.*

*\\*\\*For full-time caregivers meeting certain requirements.*
**Don't just take it from us***"The work/life balance for sales reps is real. They treat you with respect and like family."* - Amedisys sales associate
  

Responsibilities  

* Educates health care professionals, patients, and families about home care services.
* Develops and maintains relationships with key referral sources, such as hospitals, nursing homes and physician offices to generate leads.
* Coordinates patient admissions with the team, including obtaining all required documentation to complete referral to admission process.
* Conducts on-site visits to assess patient needs and identify barriers to care.
* Keeps accurate records of patient interactions and referrals.
* Achieves admissions, product, and payor-mix goals.
* Meets short and long-term target account goals.
* Documents the minimum expectation of sales calls daily in CRM (including pre and post call notes).
* Maintains a complete, up-to-date record of targeted referral sources in territory in CRM.
* Attends community events to promote Amedisys.
* Responds to customer complaints in timely manner.
* Performs other duties as assigned.

  

Qualifications  

* At least one year of experience in a healthcare related business development/outreach role. A bachelors degree is preferred, but not required.
* Reliable transportation, current driver's license, and liability insurance.

Please note: This role will travel 50% or more within the assigned territory.
*Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several U.S. geographic markets and may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.?**Amedisys is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified employees and applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, pregnancy, marital status, national origin, citizenship status, disability, military status, sexual orientation, genetic predisposition or carrier status or any other legally protected characteristic.*

title: Supply Inventory Specialist Surgical Services
description:
Sign On Bonus : $2,500

**Position Summary**

Orders and maintains par levels for inventory in the Surgical Services Department.

**Essential Functions and Responsibilities Includes the Following:** 

* Understands and adheres to the Performance Standards, Policies and Behaviors.
* Conducts inventory counts, orders, and restocks items on a daily basis
* Maintains inventory levels based on current usage and par levels set by the Surgical Services Materials & Business Manager (SSMBM)
* Works closely with the SSMBM and Nursing to ensure adequate levels of supplies are always available on the shelves
* Reviews the Operating Room, Cardiac Cath Lab, and Endoscopy department procedure schedules on a daily basis and ensures product availability
* Places requisitions for supply orders through Meditech.
* Restocks shelves on a first in, first out basis and ensures product is kept neat, organized, and easily accessible
* Works with the Purchasing Department to confirm orders and product availability
* Proactively checks for product backorders, communicates and provides updates to the SSMBM and Nursing
* Serve as specific and dedicated Service Line Liaisons- works closely with the Operating Room Service Line Leaders for service updates, inventory concerns, and product backorders
* Perform and assist in the Surgical Services annual inventory count
* Accepts and documents shipments of human donated tissue in accordance with Hospital, the New York Department of Health, and the Joint Commission standards
* Maintains a clean and safe environment for all staff members and patients
* Attends mandatory monthly staff meetings and in-services as appropriate
* Completes annual department and hospital competency requirements and documents appropriately on Hospital's Competency/Education Record
* Adheres to all policies and procedures including dress code, code of conduct, customer service, attendance and submission of annual occupational health requirements
